text.last_approved_text: Rumours reach Arkhan that relics of Nagash have been discovered in Al Haikk. Arkhan should take this realm and purge it if he must, for his master might be close.

mission_text.text: Rumours reach Arkhan that relics of Nagash have been discovered in Al Haikk. Arkhan should take this realm and purge it if he must, for his master might be close.

text.last_approved_text: The Master's Aura

mission_text.text: The Master's Aura

text.last_approved_text: Arkhan has always been more than a mere Liche - in his mortal days he was a general and soldier first, and never lost a battle…

mission_text.text: Arkhan has always been more than a mere Liche - in his mortal days he was a general and soldier first, and never lost a battle…

text.last_approved_text: Never Lost

mission_text.text: Never Lost

text.last_approved_text: Prove Your Worth

mission_text.text: Prove Your Worth

text.last_approved_text: The Liche King is one of the most powerful creatures that walks this world. And so he must exude such power by attaining the twelfth rank.

mission_text.text: The Liche King is one of the most powerful creatures that walks this world. And so he must exude such power by attaining the twelfth rank.

text.last_approved_text: A Few Dozen More

mission_text.text: A Few Dozen More

text.last_approved_text: The rituals and incantations of the Liche King require base minerals such as salt and lime. Arkhan must send minions forth to locate these resources.

mission_text.text: The rituals and incantations of the Liche King require base minerals such as salt and lime. Arkhan must send minions forth to locate these resources.

mission_text.text: Needs More Salt

mission_text.text: Old Dynasties

text.last_approved_text: Like his master, much of Arkhan's power resides in the relics and items imbued with power. Needs must that he leave his capital and in search of such a relic.

mission_text.text: Like his master, much of Arkhan's power resides in the relics and items imbued with power. Needs must that he leave his capital and in search of such a relic.

text.last_approved_text: Don't Question Fate

mission_text.text: Don't Question Fate

text.last_approved_text: It is right that the Liche Priests serve the Liche King. Arkhan shall have them tame the relics of old and craft new tools for the travails to come.

mission_text.text: It is right that the Liche Priests serve the Liche King. Arkhan shall have them tame the relics of old and craft new tools for the travails to come.

text.last_approved_text: They Serve

mission_text.text: They Serve

text.last_approved_text: Arkhan is feared throughout the lands - even Tomb Kings will think twice before engaging him in battle. But fear is transient - Arkhan must maintain his power, and increase his rank to ensure compliance.

mission_text.text: Arkhan is feared throughout the lands - even Tomb Kings will think twice before engaging him in battle. But fear is transient - Arkhan must maintain his power, and increase his rank to ensure compliance.
Outranked

text.last_approved_text: Control of the world is not only about causing death. Dominance of resources, both natural and crafted, is another form of leverage.

mission_text.text: Control of the world is not only about causing death. Dominance of resources, both natural and crafted, is another form of leverage.
Leverage

text.last_approved_text: The Black Tower of Arkhan belongs to no one but the Liche King himself. It is time for him to return.

text.last_approved_text: A great burden, it will cost much for Arkhan to enact his scheme and put events into motion that may bring back his master. He must be prepared and at the apex of his power.

mission_text.text: Ultimate Rank

text.last_approved_text: The dead do not just harvest the bodies of their foes, for the Tomb Kings, and Khatep especially, may have use for the myriad other resources that mortals desire.

text.last_approved_text: The Black Pyramid, the greatest legacy of Nagash, hums to life and so it must be taken. If the King of Kings has no use for it, then the Mortuary Cult can certainly plunder the secrets within.

mission_text.text: The Black Pyramid, the greatest legacy of Nagash, hums to life and so it must be taken. If the King of Kings has no use for it, then the Mortuary Cult can certainly plunder the secrets within.

text.last_approved_text: An action that could lead to misery, for there is only one king that should reign in a dark tower, and he is not the Liche King - not that bag of bones. No, only the King of Kings can author this action.

text.last_approved_text: Arkhan spies the parched lands in need of taming - he shall bring them into shadow. It is a desert of the dead that should answer not to a Tomb King, but a Liche King… and on the horizon is Khemri itself, where Settra sits smug on the throne. His time will come.

text.last_approved_text: As Arkhan's shadow realm expands, he will inevitably encounter the borders of hostiles. Those Tomb Kings are too blind - their rotting eyes lost - to see what gifts Nagash shall bring unto the world. It is the Liche King's task to prepare the way, to coat the land in shadow for the Arch-Necromancer's resurrection!

mission_text.text: As Arkhan's shadow realm expands, he will inevitably encounter the borders of hostiles. Those Tomb Kings are too blind - their rotting eyes lost - to see what gifts Nagash shall bring unto the world. text.last_approved_text: The Liche King's empire will rise from the bones of his enemies. Even mighty Settra shall kneel - if he hasn't done so already - or be destroyed. Continue the conquest - raze what is useless, hunt what is needed, make ready the lands for the Mortarch's call. The kingdom of Arkhan is all.

text.last_approved_text: In Sight of the Black Tower

text.last_approved_text: The living and the dead will suffer at the hands of the Liche King. For countless generations, Arkhan the Black has vented his rage at many foes, but now, on the eve of great change, the Liche King tempers his anger into domination. He prepares the way for the only possible arrival.

mission_text.text: The living and the dead will suffer at the hands of the Liche King. For countless generations, Arkhan the Black has vented his rage at many foes, but now, on the eve of great change, the Liche King tempers his anger into domination. He prepares the way for the only possible arrival.

text.last_approved_text: All Will Suffer

text.last_approved_text: Finally, after countless centuries, Arkhan the Black, the Liche King, shall raise and destroy and take what is rightfully his - the world! Bequeathed to him by the Supreme Lord of the Undead himself. All shall bow before the Black King, they will have no choice for their souls shall belong to Arkhan.

text.last_approved_text: There are those who encroach on Lybaras, who mistake that the stillness and calm of High Queen Khalida as inaction or indolence. They will learn, the queen rises from her throne, trespassers, intruders and usurpers shall rue the day they invoked the rage of Khalida!

mission_text.text: There are those who encroach on Lybaras, who mistake that the stillness and calm of High Queen Khalida as inaction or indolence. They will learn, the queen rises from her throne, trespassers, intruders and usurpers shall rue the day they invoked the rage of Khalida!

text.last_approved_text: The Throne of Lybaras

mission_text.text: The Throne of Lybaras

text.last_approved_text: Khalida is beloved by Asaph; the snake shall strike through her champion, seeking out enemies both living or dead. But before the serpent can hunt, it must secure its nest. The queendom of Lybaras is ripe for expansion.

mission_text.text: Khalida is beloved by Asaph; the snake shall strike through her champion, seeking out enemies both living or dead. But before the serpent can hunt, it must secure its nest. The queendom of Lybaras is ripe for expansion.

text.last_approved_text: Realm of the Asp Goddess

text.last_approved_text: Before the asp can strike it must coil, tensing its body for the inevitable attack. Khalida should ready her empire in the same way. Her followers must coil, creating a solid foundation for the imminent attack.

mission_text.text: Before the asp can strike it must coil, tensing its body for the inevitable attack. Khalida should ready her empire in the same way. Her followers must coil, creating a solid foundation for the imminent attack.

text.last_approved_text: With Lybaras thriving, the queen can look to spreading her venom throughout the land. But her ultimate goal is nothing as vacuous as Settra - she cares not for how mighty her empire grows, merely that this will leave her unchallenged to hunt the real foe - the spawn of Lahmia.

text.last_approved_text: All shall tremble before a queen mighty and merciless. She will purge the lands of Vampire taint. But do not let the living think themselves safe from Khalida, for they are the stock on which the hated night creatures feed. Let the High Queen purge the world no matter if hearts beats within her prey or not.

text.last_approved_text: For centuries Khatep has wandered the world in anguish. His desire is to return to Khemri and be forgiven for the sin of rousing Settra before the Day of Awakening. To make amends, the Liche Lord must gather around him other outcasts of Khemri and forge a powerbase, then answers may be found and, if not outright forgiveness... leniency from the Imperishable.

To make amends, the Liche Lord must gather around him other outcasts of Khemri and forge a powerbase, then answers may be found and, if not outright forgiveness... leniency from the Imperishable.

text.last_approved_text: Anguish of the Liche Lord

mission_text.text: Anguish of the Liche Lord

text.last_approved_text: Nehekhara beckons. But the time is not right, the return to the Land of the Dead must come with greatness and a vast trove of fresh lore. To that end, Khatep needs to continue his expansion in the chill realms.

mission_text.text: Nehekhara beckons. But the time is not right, the return to the Land of the Dead must come with greatness and a vast trove of fresh lore. To that end, Khatep needs to continue his expansion in the chill realms.

text.last_approved_text: Resurgence of the Liche Lord

mission_text.text: Resurgence of the Liche Lord

text.last_approved_text: The claws of the Liche Lord delve deeper into the land. No longer a mere itinerant, the exile and his outcast followers have put down roots and must continue to expand. If they can't go to Nehekhara - yet - then the desert shall come to them!

mission_text.text: The claws of the Liche Lord delve deeper into the land. No longer a mere itinerant, the exile and his outcast followers have put down roots and must continue to expand. If they can't go to Nehekhara - yet - then the desert shall come to them!

text.last_approved_text: Bring the Desert to Them

mission_text.text: Bring the Desert to Them

text.last_approved_text: The nascent empire of Undeath, under the stewardship of the Grand Hierophant, thrives. The Mortuary Cult has ever been willing to serve the Tomb Kings, but now their leader wields its power to serve the Cult itself. But such influence is meaningless if their sole, original purpose cannot be fulfilled - to bring about the Day of Awakening.

mission_text.text: The nascent empire of Undeath, under the stewardship of the Grand Hierophant, thrives. The Mortuary Cult has ever been willing to serve the Tomb Kings, but now their leader wields its power to serve the Cult itself. But such influence is meaningless if their sole, original purpose cannot be fulfilled - to bring about the Day of Awakening.

text.last_approved_text: Rise of the Liche Lord

mission_text.text: Rise of the Liche Lord

text.last_approved_text: Now, at last, is the time for the Liche Lord to exercise the power he has been building. Now is the time to grow the empire he has founded and show those in Khemri and its surrounding kingdoms that the exiles are ready to return.

mission_text.text: Now, at last, is the time for the Liche Lord to exercise the power he has been building. Now is the time to grow the empire he has founded and show those in Khemri and its surrounding kingdoms that the exiles are ready to return.

text.last_approved_text: Oh mighty, Settra... Great King, the Imperishable, Khemrikhara, The Great King of Nehekhara, King of Kings, Opener of the Way, Wielder of the Divine Flame, Punisher of Nomads, The Great Unifier, Commander of the Golden Legion, Sacred of Appearance, Bringer of Light, Father of Hawks, Builder of Cities, Protector of the Two Worlds, Keeper of the Hours, Chosen of Ptra, High Steward of the Horizon, Sailor of the Great Vitae, Sentinel of the Two Realms, The Undisputed, Begetter of the Begat, Scourge of the Faithless, Carrion-feeder, First of the Charnel Valley, Rider of the Sacred Chariot, Vanquisher of Vermin, Champion of the Death Arena, Mighty Lion Of The Infinite Desert, Emperor Of The Shifting Sands, He Who Holds The Sceptre, Great Hawk Of The Heavens, Arch-Sultan of Atalan, Waker of the Hierotitan, text.last_approved_text: Khemri has ever-been the greatest city and capital of Nehekhara. To let such status wane would taint not only the city but mighty Settra as well. The city must expand beyond its traditional borders. Any in the path of expansion must submit and give unquestioning allegiance to Khemri and its king, or feel his wrath.

mission_text.text: Khemri has ever-been the greatest city and capital of Nehekhara. To let such status wane would taint not only the city but mighty Settra as well. The city must expand beyond its traditional borders. Any in the path of expansion must submit and give unquestioning allegiance to Khemri and its king, or feel his wrath.

text.last_approved_text: Allegiance to Khemri

mission_text.text: Allegiance to Khemri

text.last_approved_text: Now is the moment for the King of Kings to expand his domain. The world is a cauldron of war and instability begging for the dominance of Settra to bring order. Make it so.

mission_text.text: Now is the moment for the King of Kings to expand his domain. The world is a cauldron of war and instability begging for the dominance of Settra to bring order. Make it so.

text.last_approved_text: The Great Unifier

mission_text.text: The Great Unifier

text.last_approved_text: It is said that every man has a master - be it a parent, a superior, a lord or even a god. But not Settra - he serves none but himself and has done for eternity. For he is the King of Kings and so all other kings must bow to him. Yet there are still those who shun his greatness. Capture such wayward settlements, so their denizens can be corrected!

mission_text.text: It is said that every man has a master - be it a parent, a superior, a lord or even a god. But not Settra - he serves none but himself and has done for eternity. For he is the King of Kings and so all other kings must bow to him. Yet there are still those who shun his greatness. Capture such wayward settlements, so their denizens can be corrected!

text.last_approved_text: King of Kings

mission_text.text: King of Kings

text.last_approved_text: Even the gods look upon Settra in deference… or they should. The Great King shall rule all; a vast empire that no living monarch could ever hope to attain. That is not a mere desire that is fate being bent to the will of Settra the Imperishable!

mission_text.text: Even the gods look upon Settra in deference… or they should. The Great King shall rule all; a vast empire that no living monarch could ever hope to attain. That is not a mere desire that is fate being bent to the will of Settra the Imperishable!

text.last_approved_text: Kingdom of the Gods

mission_text.text: Kingdom of the Gods

text.last_approved_text: Warlord Doomclaw makes many demands of Tretch. The first is to gain a substantial tail-hold in this ice-ravaged land. Gnaw deep into this realm's roots so it may one day rival Crookback Mountain as a lair for Clan Rictus.

mission_text.text: Warlord Doomclaw makes many demands of Tretch. The first is to gain a substantial tail-hold in this ice-ravaged land. Gnaw deep into this realm's roots so it may one day rival Crookback Mountain as a lair for Clan Rictus.

text.last_approved_text: From the Deep Warrens

mission_text.text: From the Deep Warrens

text.last_approved_text: A tail-hold in this region is not enough. No-no. The Clan must spread, must infest the underground and riddle it with our spawn. We shall take this realm's wealth and use it for our ends - that is the Clan Rictus way.

mission_text.text: A tail-hold in this region is not enough. No-no. The Clan must spread, must infest the underground and riddle it with our spawn. We shall take this realm's wealth and use it for our ends - that is the Clan Rictus way.

text.last_approved_text: Not One, Many-Many

mission_text.text: Not One, Many-Many

text.last_approved_text: It goes well for Tretch - yet again the Craventail has proven himself resilient and able to almost preternaturally dodge trouble, much to the annoyance of his foes. Yet… the labour is not yet complete. The rise of Clan Rictus must continue.

mission_text.text: It goes well for Tretch - yet again the Craventail has proven himself resilient and able to almost preternaturally dodge trouble, much to the annoyance of his foes. Yet… the labour is not yet complete. The rise of Clan Rictus must continue.

text.last_approved_text: The Rise of Rictus

mission_text.text: The Rise of Rictus

text.last_approved_text: Rictus is well established in its new land. Craventail's burgeoning proto-empire continues to grow, gnawing just under the surface. Yet, there are still many nuisances in this world - both vermin and ‘things’ - best to eradicate all so that only Clan Rictus remains. For the Horned Rat! …and his brave, dedicated servant.

mission_text.text: Rictus is well established in its new land. Craventail's burgeoning proto-empire continues to grow, gnawing just under the surface. Yet, there are still many nuisances in this world - both vermin and ‘things’ - best to eradicate all so that only Clan Rictus remains. For the Horned Rat! …and his brave, dedicated servant.

text.last_approved_text: Gnawing at the World

mission_text.text: Gnawing at the World

text.last_approved_text: The plan is all but complete; Clan Rictus has grown like a canker, establishing a noisome empire to rival any nest-lair in the Under-Empire, yes-yes! A few more tasks will ensure Tretch can rival the Council - Lord Doomclaw himself will surely be proud-incensed!

text.last_approved_text: The Lizardmen are many, birthed from spawning pools and bred for war. Kroq-Gar will need as many strong Skinks and Saurus at his command, for to destroy the forces of Chaos will be no easy task.

mission_text.text: The Lizardmen are many, birthed from spawning pools and bred for war. Kroq-Gar will need as many strong Skinks and Saurus at his command, for to destroy the forces of Chaos will be no easy task.

text.last_approved_text: The Call to War

mission_text.text: The Call to War

text.last_approved_text: Kroq-Gar is well-versed in war. As the last defender of the doomed city of Xhotl in the Great Catastrophe, he has seen the face of Chaos up close, and emerged victorious. There is no better choice to continue leading the assault against Ruin.

mission_text.text: Kroq-Gar is well-versed in war. As the last defender of the doomed city of Xhotl in the Great Catastrophe, he has seen the face of Chaos up close, and emerged victorious. There is no better choice to continue leading the assault against Ruin.

text.last_approved_text: What a Kroq!

mission_text.text: What a Kroq!

text.last_approved_text: Lizardmen history is littered with the mighty exploits of noble individuals that helped staunch the tide of Chaos; true heroes of Lustria. These noble warriors must surely be a part of the Great Plan, born to enact the Old One's will.

mission_text.text: Lizardmen history is littered with the mighty exploits of noble individuals that helped staunch the tide of Chaos; true heroes of Lustria. These noble warriors must surely be a part of the Great Plan, born to enact the Old One's will.

text.last_approved_text: I Need a Hero

mission_text.text: I Need a Hero

text.last_approved_text: Kroq-Gar is a Saurus, the mightiest of his already prestigious brood. The Saurus are the solid core of any Lizardman force, born to wage war and protect Lustria. They emerge from spawning pools fully-formed and ready for the battlefield.

mission_text.text: Kroq-Gar is a Saurus, the mightiest of his already prestigious brood. The Saurus are the solid core of any Lizardman force, born to wage war and protect Lustria. They emerge from spawning pools fully-formed and ready for the battlefield.

text.last_approved_text: Do You Think He Saurus?

mission_text.text: Do You Think He Saurus?

text.last_approved_text: It is believed, through the wisdom of Mazdamundi, that the Old One's plan cannot be enacted until certain conditions are met. And so the learned mage-priest sets forth decrees and objectives, that he determines are vital to anticipate the Old One's desires.

mission_text.text: It is believed, through the wisdom of Mazdamundi, that the Old One's plan cannot be enacted until certain conditions are met. And so the learned mage-priest sets forth decrees and objectives, that he determines are vital to anticipate the Old One's desires.

text.last_approved_text: His Master's Voice

mission_text.text: His Master's Voice

text.last_approved_text: From the mighty Saurus to the teeming Skinks, to the towering and imposing Bastiladon, all Lizardmen must be employed to the effort of war against the warm bloods. It, after all, demanded of them.

mission_text.text: From the mighty Saurus to the teeming Skinks, to the towering and imposing Bastiladon, all Lizardmen must be employed to the effort of war against the warm bloods. It, after all, demanded of them.

text.last_approved_text: Spawn of War

mission_text.text: Spawn of War

text.last_approved_text: Kroq-Gar knows only war, knows only battle. Since escaping the collapse of Xhotl, he stalked the jungles of Lustria, bringing destruction to all his enemies, until Mazdamundi summoned him, to give his rage a focus; it is this purpose that drives him now.

mission_text.text: Kroq-Gar knows only war, knows only battle. Since escaping the collapse of Xhotl, he stalked the jungles of Lustria, bringing destruction to all his enemies, until Mazdamundi summoned him, to give his rage a focus; it is this purpose that drives him now.

text.last_approved_text: The Last Defender

mission_text.text: The Last Defender

text.last_approved_text: The domestication of the ferocious, but dim-witted, Cold Ones turned the already formidable Saurus warrior into a destructive cavalry force. Not only does the Saurus fight furiously, but their steed, also, cannot resist gnashing and ripping into foes with its claws and teeth.

mission_text.text: The domestication of the ferocious, but dim-witted, Cold Ones turned the already formidable Saurus warrior into a destructive cavalry force. Not only does the Saurus fight furiously, but their steed, also, cannot resist gnashing and ripping into foes with its claws and teeth.

text.last_approved_text: Ice Rider

mission_text.text: Ice Rider

text.last_approved_text: Though the Slann Mage-Priests are wise, they prove difficult to understand. The Slann speak telepathically, and are often locked in meditative trances. Only the Skink Priests, through great effort, are able to commune with their masters and divine their will.

mission_text.text: Though the Slann Mage-Priests are wise, they prove difficult to understand. The Slann speak telepathically, and are often locked in meditative trances. Only the Skink Priests, through great effort, are able to commune with their masters and divine their will.

text.last_approved_text: So Sure, Sotek

mission_text.text: So Sure, Sotek

text.last_approved_text: It is only the Slann Mage-Priests who truly understand the complexities of the Great Plan. They are not to be distrusted, and so their demands must be met, for they speak with the voice of the gods.

mission_text.text: It is only the Slann Mage-Priests who truly understand the complexities of the Great Plan. They are not to be distrusted, and so their demands must be met, for they speak with the voice of the gods.

text.last_approved_text: What is Your Quest?

mission_text.text: What is Your Quest?

text.last_approved_text: Only through constant battle, and tireless fury, can Kroq-Gar hope to lead his forces to victory over Chaos. Amongst the ruined temples of Lustria, and from countless spawning pools, he must draw more and more Lizardmen to his cause, to fight under his banner.

mission_text.text: Only through constant battle, and tireless fury, can Kroq-Gar hope to lead his forces to victory over Chaos. Amongst the ruined temples of Lustria, and from countless spawning pools, he must draw more and more Lizardmen to his cause, to fight under his banner.

text.last_approved_text: Spawn of War II

mission_text.text: Spawn of War II

text.last_approved_text: Kroq-Gar is a warrior beyond any of his cold-blooded ilk. When he rides to war ,the enemy should know they are about to face greatness, and likely destruction. With the gifts of Mazdamundi at his disposal, his fury and power cannot be matched.

mission_text.text: Kroq-Gar is a warrior beyond any of his cold-blooded ilk. When he rides to war ,the enemy should know they are about to face greatness, and likely destruction. With the gifts of Mazdamundi at his disposal, his fury and power cannot be matched.

text.last_approved_text: Kroq-Gar, Triumphant

mission_text.text: Kroq-Gar, Triumphant

text.last_approved_text: The disappearance of the Old Ones taught the Lizardmen one thing - they cannot exist without leaders, without direction. And so leaders must emerge, both wise mage-priest and mighty warriors, to drive the Lizardmen forward, to ever greater glory.

mission_text.text: The disappearance of the Old Ones taught the Lizardmen one thing - they cannot exist without leaders, without direction. And so leaders must emerge, both wise mage-priest and mighty warriors, to drive the Lizardmen forward, to ever greater glory.

text.last_approved_text: Executors of the Plan

mission_text.text: Executors of the Plan

text.last_approved_text: Unlike some other Lizardmen, a Saurus is not a witless creature; they are extremely sharp creatures, focused relentlessly on the pursuit of war. They are born knowing how to fight, and itching to get to the battlefield to prove their skill.

mission_text.text: Unlike some other Lizardmen, a Saurus is not a witless creature; they are extremely sharp creatures, focused relentlessly on the pursuit of war. They are born knowing how to fight, and itching to get to the battlefield to prove their skill.

text.last_approved_text: Born for War

mission_text.text: Born for War

text.last_approved_text: Kroq-Gar sets forth on his mandated mission with a steely determination, befitting of his role as assigned by Mazdamundi. To be sure, for his journey to be successful, he must do much and more that is demanded of him from his Slann overlord.

mission_text.text: Kroq-Gar sets forth on his mandated mission with a steely determination, befitting of his role as assigned by Mazdamundi. To be sure, for his journey to be successful, he must do much and more that is demanded of him from his Slann overlord.

text.last_approved_text: The Plan Demands

mission_text.text: The Plan Demands

text.last_approved_text: From coast to coast, they must rise up; the Lizardmen. From the spawning pools across Lustria, the call to war drives them ever onward, and the Old One's desires ensures they can never stop.

mission_text.text: From coast to coast, they must rise up; the Lizardmen. From the spawning pools across Lustria, the call to war drives them ever onward, and the Old One's desires ensures they can never stop.

text.last_approved_text: Spawn of War III

mission_text.text: Spawn of War III

text.last_approved_text: War is in the Lizardmen's blood. From the tenacious anger of the Skinks, to the charging fury of the Troglodons, they are evolved for war. And so war they shall have, in the name of Lustria.

mission_text.text: War is in the Lizardmen's blood. From the tenacious anger of the Skinks, to the charging fury of the Troglodons, they are evolved for war. And so war they shall have, in the name of Lustria.

text.last_approved_text: Jungle Fever

mission_text.text: Jungle Fever

text.last_approved_text: The Great Plan is not something that all Lizardmen innately know. It is handed down from the Slann to their Skink Priests, and then to the rest. Lizardmen rely on great leaders and prophets to guide their actions.

mission_text.text: The Great Plan is not something that all Lizardmen innately know. It is handed down from the Slann to their Skink Priests, and then to the rest. Lizardmen rely on great leaders and prophets to guide their actions.

text.last_approved_text: Lizardly Leaders

mission_text.text: Lizardly Leaders

text.last_approved_text: The great beasts of Lustria are greater than any Skink or Saurus. Mighty Carnosaurs, ponderous Bastiladons, and towering Stegadons process through the jungle canopy, and can be brought to bear by any Saurus bold enough to tame them.

mission_text.text: The great beasts of Lustria are greater than any Skink or Saurus. Mighty Carnosaurs, ponderous Bastiladons, and towering Stegadons process through the jungle canopy, and can be brought to bear by any Saurus bold enough to tame them.

text.last_approved_text: Jurassic March

mission_text.text: Jurassic March

text.last_approved_text: It is not for Kroq-Qar to defy the will of Mazdamundi, nor his place to question the Old Ones' intentions. It is for him to relentlessly chase that which he is set after, and claim victory for the Lizardmen by any means necessary.

mission_text.text: It is not for Kroq-Qar to defy the will of Mazdamundi, nor his place to question the Old Ones' intentions. It is for him to relentlessly chase that which he is set after, and claim victory for the Lizardmen by any means necessary.

text.last_approved_text: Come On & Slann

mission_text.text: Come On & Slann

text.last_approved_text: The Carnosaur is the apex predator of the Lustrian jungles. Huge, muscular creates, the Carnosaur can move with surprising speed for such a large beast, and is lethal when attacking with its enormous, axe-like maw. Upon their backs, a Lizardman warrior is king of the battlefield.

mission_text.text: The Carnosaur is the apex predator of the Lustrian jungles. Huge, muscular creates, the Carnosaur can move with surprising speed for such a large beast, and is lethal when attacking with its enormous, axe-like maw. Upon their backs, a Lizardman warrior is king of the battlefield.

text.last_approved_text: Feral, Interactive

mission_text.text: Feral, Interactive

text.last_approved_text: The Lizardmen are not deliberately malicious creatures, like the Skaven or their northern enemies, the Dark Elves. However, they care not for the machinations of others, only the realisation of their Great Plan. Anyone foolish enough to interfere faces the full fury of the Lustrians.

mission_text.text: The Lizardmen are not deliberately malicious creatures, like the Skaven or their northern enemies, the Dark Elves. However, they care not for the machinations of others, only the realisation of their Great Plan. Anyone foolish enough to interfere faces the full fury of the Lustrians.
Cold-Blooded

text.last_approved_text: There are no others like Kroq-Gar, there is only Kroq-Gar. As long as he can remember, the Saurus knows only war. In his mind's eye, he still sees Xhotl, his home, and to him his battle to defend it never ends.

mission_text.text: There are no others like Kroq-Gar, there is only Kroq-Gar. As long as he can remember, the Saurus knows only war. In his mind's eye, he still sees Xhotl, his home, and to him his battle to defend it never ends.

text.last_approved_text: Be On Your Gar

mission_text.text: Be On Your Gar

text.last_approved_text: Even the Lizardmen fear the unbridled fury of the jungle beasts, for their ire is indiscriminate. Lustria, more than any Saurus, belongs to the beasts. Yet when harnessed and domesticated, their primordial fury can be directed at Lizardmen enemies with resounding success.

mission_text.text: Even the Lizardmen fear the unbridled fury of the jungle beasts, for their ire is indiscriminate. Lustria, more than any Saurus, belongs to the beasts. Yet when harnessed and domesticated, their primordial fury can be directed at Lizardmen enemies with resounding success.

text.last_approved_text: Lords of the Jungle

mission_text.text: Lords of the Jungle

text.last_approved_text: The Great Plan is all-consuming, even to one who does not know its intricacies. Kroq-Gar knows that his place in the plan is foreseen, for Mazdamundi has requested specifically him. When the Old Ones return, Kroq-Qar knows he will have done as they desired.

mission_text.text: The Great Plan is all-consuming, even to one who does not know its intricacies. Kroq-Gar knows that his place in the plan is foreseen, for Mazdamundi has requested specifically him. When the Old Ones return, Kroq-Qar knows he will have done as they desired.

text.last_approved_text: Lizard Let Die

mission_text.text: Lizard Let Die

text.last_approved_text: The rats of Clan Pestilens are bound by one purpose, given to them specifically by the Great Horned Rat. To this end, they will rise above the Under-Empire and to the land of men, and their corruption will overflow to the very ends of the world.

mission_text.text: The rats of Clan Pestilens are bound by one purpose, given to them specifically by the Great Horned Rat. To this end, they will rise above the Under-Empire and to the land of men, and their corruption will overflow to the very ends of the world.

text.last_approved_text: Up, Up & Away!

mission_text.text: Up, Up & Away!

text.last_approved_text: The Plague Monks serve only one God: death. Above all else, they desire to spread foul disease and terminal infection across the world. Even to the Skaven, they are abominable to look upon, soiled and dishevelled rags covering them as they chant from the Book of Woe.

mission_text.text: The Plague Monks serve only one God: death. Above all else, they desire to spread foul disease and terminal infection across the world. Even to the Skaven, they are abominable to look upon, soiled and dishevelled rags covering them as they chant from the Book of Woe.

text.last_approved_text: The Good Book

mission_text.text: The Good Book

text.last_approved_text: The pestilential zealotry of a Plague Priest is above that of even the Plague Monks. They are charged with spreading disease the world over, converting even their own bodies into altars of foul infection, as an example for the lesser Monks to follow.

mission_text.text: The pestilential zealotry of a Plague Priest is above that of even the Plague Monks. They are charged with spreading disease the world over, converting even their own bodies into altars of foul infection, as an example for the lesser Monks to follow.

text.last_approved_text: Sermon on the Mold

mission_text.text: Sermon on the Mold

text.last_approved_text: Clan Pestilens has one goal; the spread of corruption and disease in the name of the Great Horned Rat. That they are ill-regarded even by their own ratkin is irrelevant, for their duty is to the Horned One, not the petty chittering nuisance of the Skaven.

mission_text.text: Clan Pestilens has one goal; the spread of corruption and disease in the name of the Great Horned Rat. That they are ill-regarded even by their own ratkin is irrelevant, for their duty is to the Horned One, not the petty chittering nuisance of the Skaven.

text.last_approved_text: Gross Earnings

mission_text.text: Gross Earnings

text.last_approved_text: Pestilens was born amongst the pox marshes and swamps of eastern Lustria, and despite its inhospitable climate, it is where they call home. They shall retain this homeland, in the name of the Great Horned Rat.

mission_text.text: Pestilens was born amongst the pox marshes and swamps of eastern Lustria, and despite its inhospitable climate, it is where they call home. They shall retain this homeland, in the name of the Great Horned Rat.

text.last_approved_text: Undead Rising

mission_text.text: Undead Rising

text.last_approved_text: The Skaven have a plan, and that plan will be achieved by any means necessary. In darkened, festering corners, the Skaven Plague Priests chant their invocations, summoning great catastrophe upon the world with their words.

mission_text.text: The Skaven have a plan, and that plan will be achieved by any means necessary. In darkened, festering corners, the Skaven Plague Priests chant their invocations, summoning great catastrophe upon the world with their words.

text.last_approved_text: Pestilential Preference

mission_text.text: Pestilential Preference

text.last_approved_text: The Skaven are ingenious engineers, able to use their bizarre minds to concoct and unusual weapons of war that wreak havoc, both for their enemies and Skaven alike. Clan Pestilens, of course, always finds a way to adapt these devices to their foul purposes.

mission_text.text: The Skaven are ingenious engineers, able to use their bizarre minds to concoct and unusual weapons of war that wreak havoc, both for their enemies and Skaven alike. Clan Pestilens, of course, always finds a way to adapt these devices to their foul purposes.

text.last_approved_text: Gonna Hurl

mission_text.text: Gonna Hurl

text.last_approved_text: Clan Pestilens arose from the feverish, infected swamps of Lustria. There, the afflicted and delirious ratmen were visited by an epiphany; the Great Horned Rat demanded that they spread pestilence the world over, in exchange for their measly lives. Desperate and febrile, they accepted.

mission_text.text: Clan Pestilens arose from the feverish, infected swamps of Lustria. There, the afflicted and delirious ratmen were visited by an epiphany; the Great Horned Rat demanded that they spread pestilence the world over, in exchange for their measly lives. Desperate and febrile, they accepted.

text.last_approved_text: Archbishop of Decay

mission_text.text: Archbishop of Decay

text.last_approved_text: The Skaven mind is a curious thing; cunning rats capable of cunning things. The engineers of the ratmen are proficient at creating unusual weapons of vast destruction, from Jezzails, to Doom-Flayers, to the truly terrifying Warp Lightning Cannon, hurling destruction across the battlefield.

mission_text.text: The Skaven mind is a curious thing; cunning rats capable of cunning things. The engineers of the ratmen are proficient at creating unusual weapons of vast destruction, from Jezzails, to Doom-Flayers, to the truly terrifying Warp Lightning Cannon, hurling destruction across the battlefield.

text.last_approved_text: Biological Warfare

mission_text.text: Biological Warfare

text.last_approved_text: The jungles of Lustria are teeming with foul disease and humid corruption. It is here that Clan Pestilens found their purpose, and it is here that they will continue their quest in the name of the Great Horned Rat.

mission_text.text: The jungles of Lustria are teeming with foul disease and humid corruption. It is here that Clan Pestilens found their purpose, and it is here that they will continue their quest in the name of the Great Horned Rat.

text.last_approved_text: Humid Desires

mission_text.text: Humid Desires

text.last_approved_text: Clan Pestilens dreams of a future where the world is drowned in filth and detritus, swamping the lands of man and their glittering towers. They will all fall to disease; none shall be left standing but Pestilens.

mission_text.text: Clan Pestilens dreams of a future where the world is drowned in filth and detritus, swamping the lands of man and their glittering towers. They will all fall to disease; none shall be left standing but Pestilens.

text.last_approved_text: Reach for the Scars

mission_text.text: Reach for the Scars

text.last_approved_text: The Great Horned Rat demanded of the Clan Pestilens leaders of old that they dedicate themselves, unwaveringly, to the spread of disease. Every moment they exist, the Plague Monks are tirelessly concocting new infections, to better corrupt the world.

mission_text.text: The Great Horned Rat demanded of the Clan Pestilens leaders of old that they dedicate themselves, unwaveringly, to the spread of disease. Every moment they exist, the Plague Monks are tirelessly concocting new infections, to better corrupt the world.

text.last_approved_text: Down With the Sickness

mission_text.text: Down With the Sickness

text.last_approved_text: The Plague Monks answer to the Plague Priests, who themselves answer only to the Plaguelords of Clan Pestilens themselves. The greatest and boldest of the Monks are recognised for their filth, and promised commendation by the Great Horned Rat himself, when their mission is finally accomplished.

mission_text.text: The Plague Monks answer to the Plague Priests, who themselves answer only to the Plaguelords of Clan Pestilens themselves. The greatest and boldest of the Monks are recognised for their filth, and promised commendation by the Great Horned Rat himself, when their mission is finally accomplished.

text.last_approved_text: Unholy Calling

mission_text.text: Unholy Calling

text.last_approved_text: Every bubo is a badge of honour to Clan Pestilens; the Plague Priests are held aloft as the ideal; they have converted themselves wholesale to the incubation of filth. Their skin festers and broils under the weight of disease, pus-filled sores telling of the glory they have nurtured.

mission_text.text: Every bubo is a badge of honour to Clan Pestilens; the Plague Priests are held aloft as the ideal; they have converted themselves wholesale to the incubation of filth. Their skin festers and broils under the weight of disease, pus-filled sores telling of the glory they have nurtured.

text.last_approved_text: Tied With a Bubo

mission_text.text: Tied With a Bubo

text.last_approved_text: Lustria is a perfect ecosystem for the needs of Clan Pestilens - every foul swamp is teeming with new and interesting diseases, and every feverish day beats down a relentless heat, incubating and nurturing any potential illnesses.

mission_text.text: Lustria is a perfect ecosystem for the needs of Clan Pestilens - every foul swamp is teeming with new and interesting diseases, and every feverish day beats down a relentless heat, incubating and nurturing any potential illnesses.
Home-Grown

text.last_approved_text: The world as it is cannot be allowed to continue. So is the decree of the Great Horned Rat, handed down to Clan Pestilens. The 'clean' world must be pushed aside, swept away by a deluge of disease.

mission_text.text: The world as it is cannot be allowed to continue. So is the decree of the Great Horned Rat, handed down to Clan Pestilens. The 'clean' world must be pushed aside, swept away by a deluge of disease.

text.last_approved_text: Cry Foul

mission_text.text: Cry Foul

text.last_approved_text: To face an army of Clan Pestilens is an endurance test for the senses, as much as of the body. Not only do the rats bring sores upon their very bodies, but they hurl their foul disease into enemy ranks from the backs of engineer-wrought catapults.

mission_text.text: To face an army of Clan Pestilens is an endurance test for the senses, as much as of the body. Not only do the rats bring sores upon their very bodies, but they hurl their foul disease into enemy ranks from the backs of engineer-wrought catapults.

text.last_approved_text: Don't Plague By the Rules

mission_text.text: Don't Plague By the Rules

text.last_approved_text: Plague Priests wield fierce and disgusting magical power, which they claim is granted to them by the Great Horned Rat himself. True or not, it is clear they are supremely powerful - their noxious abilities can reduce an opponent to a quivering mess of disease almost instantly.

mission_text.text: Plague Priests wield fierce and disgusting magical power, which they claim is granted to them by the Great Horned Rat himself. True or not, it is clear they are supremely powerful - their noxious abilities can reduce an opponent to a quivering mess of disease almost instantly.

text.last_approved_text: Putrefying Vision

mission_text.text: Putrefying Vision

text.last_approved_text: Only the strongest rats in a Skaven clan rise to be leader. But strength is not determined by physical prowess alone. Indeed, often the most cunning and devious Warlords remain alive by staying five steps ahead of their rivals.

mission_text.text: Only the strongest rats in a Skaven clan rise to be leader. But strength is not determined by physical prowess alone. Indeed, often the most cunning and devious Warlords remain alive by staying five steps ahead of their rivals.

text.last_approved_text: The Strong Will Survive

mission_text.text: The Strong Will Survive

text.last_approved_text: There are others who would claim the jungles as their own - the Lizardmen, proud and suspicious creates, prowl their ruined temples and 'sacred' jungles. But Clan Pestilens is charged with duty by the Great Horned Rat - none can stand in their way.

mission_text.text: There are others who would claim the jungles as their own - the Lizardmen, proud and suspicious creates, prowl their ruined temples and 'sacred' jungles. But Clan Pestilens is charged with duty by the Great Horned Rat - none can stand in their way.
Vermintide

text.last_approved_text: What can be left when Pestilens is done with the world? Nothing, truly, can be allowed to survive. Everything must be consumed by buboes; given over completely to the cankerous, tumescent diseases unleashed in the name of the Great Horned Rat.

mission_text.text: What can be left when Pestilens is done with the world? Nothing, truly, can be allowed to survive. Everything must be consumed by buboes; given over completely to the cankerous, tumescent diseases unleashed in the name of the Great Horned Rat.

text.last_approved_text: Sea of Grime

mission_text.text: Sea of Grime

text.last_approved_text: When a Plague Monk is particularly devoted - or, perhaps driven insane by disease - they are bestowed the Plague Censer. Placed inside is a chunk of Warpstone and a ladle of disease. The Censer Bearer is then sent amongst the enemy ranks, where foul pestilence affects all.

mission_text.text: When a Plague Monk is particularly devoted - or, perhaps driven insane by disease - they are bestowed the Plague Censer. Placed inside is a chunk of Warpstone and a ladle of disease. The Censer Bearer is then sent amongst the enemy ranks, where foul pestilence affects all.
Uncensored

text.last_approved_text: Where other Skaven clans go to war with unmatched fury and terrifying hunger, to combat Clan Pestilens is to know a deeper kind of fear; every man fears death, but to die in writhing agony as disease wracks and mutates your body? There is no worse fate.

mission_text.text: Where other Skaven clans go to war with unmatched fury and terrifying hunger, to combat Clan Pestilens is to know a deeper kind of fear; every man fears death, but to die in writhing agony as disease wracks and mutates your body? There is no worse fate.

text.last_approved_text: Fair & Foul

mission_text.text: Fair & Foul

text.last_approved_text: For all that they are reviled by others, Clan Pestilens is nevertheless contracted by other Warlords when their services are required. Whether they accept or not, however, depends not on coin, but whether the service provides an opportunity to further spread disease.

mission_text.text: For all that they are reviled by others, Clan Pestilens is nevertheless contracted by other Warlords when their services are required. Whether they accept or not, however, depends not on coin, but whether the service provides an opportunity to further spread disease.

text.last_approved_text: Simply the Pest

mission_text.text: Simply the Pest

text.last_approved_text: Not content with the swamps in which they started, the ratmen of Clan Pestilens have decided that the entire Great Jungle must be theirs. Every fetid swamp and humid, squelching mire must belong to them - everything pungent must be Pestilens!

mission_text.text: Not content with the swamps in which they started, the ratmen of Clan Pestilens have decided that the entire Great Jungle must be theirs. Every fetid swamp and humid, squelching mire must belong to them - everything pungent must be Pestilens!

text.last_approved_text: Tropic Chunder

mission_text.text: Tropic Chunder

text.last_approved_text: Malekith is a lord of war, but for all his power, war is won by armies. If he is to ever march back upon his ancestral home and tear it apart, he will need strong warriors at his side.

mission_text.text: Malekith is a lord of war, but for all his power, war is won by armies. If he is to ever march back upon his ancestral home and tear it apart, he will need strong warriors at his side.

text.last_approved_text: Dark Purpose

mission_text.text: Dark Purpose

text.last_approved_text: Malekith is bred for battle, renowned as one of the greatest Elven warriors alive. His thirst for battle is quenched in gruesome combat, where he tears enemies apart in a melancholic rage.

mission_text.text: Malekith is bred for battle, renowned as one of the greatest Elven warriors alive. His thirst for battle is quenched in gruesome combat, where he tears enemies apart in a melancholic rage.

text.last_approved_text: The Sound & The Fury

mission_text.text: The Sound & The Fury

text.last_approved_text: Malekith does not care to conquer the world, only to see it burn. So slighted does he feel that he would rather see the world destroyed than control it. If he has to preside over a dominion of ashes, then so be it.

mission_text.text: Malekith does not care to conquer the world, only to see it burn. So slighted does he feel that he would rather see the world destroyed than control it. If he has to preside over a dominion of ashes, then so be it.

text.last_approved_text: Dominion of Fire

mission_text.text: Dominion of Fire

text.last_approved_text: To be imprisoned by the armies of the Witch King is a fate nobody would wish on his worst enemy. Thralls of the Druchii are subjected to back-breaking labour and torture. It is a blessed mercy to be killed early, and swiftly.

mission_text.text: To be imprisoned by the armies of the Witch King is a fate nobody would wish on his worst enemy. Thralls of the Druchii are subjected to back-breaking labour and torture. It is a blessed mercy to be killed early, and swiftly.

text.last_approved_text: Those Who Serve

mission_text.text: Those Who Serve

text.last_approved_text: Malekith is a powerful testament of his own failure. The most powerful Dark Elven Lord in existence, he was nevertheless spurned by the Asur in ages past, and eternally seeks vengeance for this unforgivable slight.

mission_text.text: Malekith is a powerful testament of his own failure. The most powerful Dark Elven Lord in existence, he was nevertheless spurned by the Asur in ages past, and eternally seeks vengeance for this unforgivable slight.

text.last_approved_text: Malekith From a Rose

mission_text.text: Malekith From a Rose

text.last_approved_text: The Merciless Host answer only to the Witch King, and ride to war under his banner. Their creed is that the strong can do as they please, for the weak are too pathetic to stop them. Glory to the mighty!

mission_text.text: The Merciless Host answer only to the Witch King, and ride to war under his banner. Their creed is that the strong can do as they please, for the weak are too pathetic to stop them. Glory to the mighty!

text.last_approved_text: The Merciless Host

mission_text.text: The Merciless Host

text.last_approved_text: Though the Asur must fall to Druchii might, there are yet others the Dark Elves cut their teeth on. The multitudinous barbarians that wander the frozen expanses provide excellent practice, whilst further south in Lustria, there are more thralls to be found.

mission_text.text: Though the Asur must fall to Druchii might, there are yet others the Dark Elves cut their teeth on. The multitudinous barbarians that wander the frozen expanses provide excellent practice, whilst further south in Lustria, there are more thralls to be found.

text.last_approved_text: The Will to Dominate

mission_text.text: The Will to Dominate

text.last_approved_text: Naggaroth and, in the south, Lustria are littered with the settlements of lesser creatures. Barbarians, Lizardmen, Vampires… all of them testaments to weakness. All of them must die, their cities burned and their hopes extinguished.

mission_text.text: Naggaroth and, in the south, Lustria are littered with the settlements of lesser creatures. Barbarians, Lizardmen, Vampires… all of them testaments to weakness. All of them must die, their cities burned and their hopes extinguished.

text.last_approved_text: Raw Destruction

mission_text.text: Raw Destruction

text.last_approved_text: Every slave taken by Malekith strengthens his fight against the High Elves. Each and every man taken provides strength to the Druchii, through manual labour or simply the sport of having them killed.

mission_text.text: Every slave taken by Malekith strengthens his fight against the High Elves. Each and every man taken provides strength to the Druchii, through manual labour or simply the sport of having them killed.

text.last_approved_text: Those Who Suffer

mission_text.text: Those Who Suffer

text.last_approved_text: Malekith has, so many times before, attempted to take his revenge on Ulthuan. Yet every time he has been rebuked, sent back scarred, but alive. Thus he endeavours to become ever stronger, ever better, so that he can finally succeed and crush the Asur forever.

mission_text.text: Malekith has, so many times before, attempted to take his revenge on Ulthuan. Yet every time he has been rebuked, sent back scarred, but alive. Thus he endeavours to become ever stronger, ever better, so that he can finally succeed and crush the Asur forever.

text.last_approved_text: Scourge of Naggaroth

mission_text.text: Scourge of Naggaroth

text.last_approved_text: The Druchii armies are terrifying forces of destruction, bent single-mindedly on conquering all before them. Each army is led by a powerful lord, a Dreadlord of Naggaroth, who drives them forward to claim their prizes in fire.

mission_text.text: The Druchii armies are terrifying forces of destruction, bent single-mindedly on conquering all before them. Each army is led by a powerful lord, a Dreadlord of Naggaroth, who drives them forward to claim their prizes in fire.

text.last_approved_text: Do or Druchii

mission_text.text: Do or Druchii

text.last_approved_text: There are few in the world who can claim to be as powerful as Malekith, the Witch King. When he rides to battle, he does so sure in the knowledge that whosoever he is about to face is soon to be utterly crushed before his might.

mission_text.text: There are few in the world who can claim to be as powerful as Malekith, the Witch King. When he rides to battle, he does so sure in the knowledge that whosoever he is about to face is soon to be utterly crushed before his might.

text.last_approved_text: The Villain in Your History

mission_text.text: The Villain in Your History

text.last_approved_text: Black Ark towers dot the landscape of Naggaroth like gnarled fingers reaching skywards. The Black Arks are the Dark Elves homes; everything beyond the horizon - to the Druchii - is fit to burn.

mission_text.text: Black Ark towers dot the landscape of Naggaroth like gnarled fingers reaching skywards. The Black Arks are the Dark Elves homes; everything beyond the horizon - to the Druchii - is fit to burn.
Pyromania

text.last_approved_text: The Dark Elves are merciless creatures but there is certainly a practical use in not killing every survivor of battle. Whilst scores of them will be executed, of course, others will be put to work. The labour will eventually kill them, naturally.

mission_text.text: The Dark Elves are merciless creatures but there is certainly a practical use in not killing every survivor of battle. Whilst scores of them will be executed, of course, others will be put to work. The labour will eventually kill them, naturally.

text.last_approved_text: Those Who Toil

mission_text.text: Those Who Toil

text.last_approved_text: Malekith is scarred by his attempt to claim the throne of Ulthuan. Though he is wracked by physical deformity, the flames also twisted his soul, forging within him an all-consuming desire for apocalyptic revenge on the Asur.

mission_text.text: Malekith is scarred by his attempt to claim the throne of Ulthuan. Though he is wracked by physical deformity, the flames also twisted his soul, forging within him an all-consuming desire for apocalyptic revenge on the Asur.

text.last_approved_text: Immortal Fury

mission_text.text: Immortal Fury

text.last_approved_text: A Druchii army is a spectacle of varied horror. Magic crackles from the sceptres of Sorceresses and Dreadlords, whilst Assassins dart in and out of perception. And above them all, Hydras and Dragons breath death into enemy ranks.

mission_text.text: A Druchii army is a spectacle of varied horror. Magic crackles from the sceptres of Sorceresses and Dreadlords, whilst Assassins dart in and out of perception. And above them all, Hydras and Dragons breath death into enemy ranks.

text.last_approved_text: Fury of the Spurned

mission_text.text: Fury of the Spurned

text.last_approved_text: The abject cruelty in every Dark Elven soldier is without question. Strength is the only determining faction to the Druchii - the strong survive and flourish, whilst the weak are destroyed.

mission_text.text: The abject cruelty in every Dark Elven soldier is without question. Strength is the only determining faction to the Druchii - the strong survive and flourish, whilst the weak are destroyed.

text.last_approved_text: Let the Bodies Hit the Floor

mission_text.text: Let the Bodies Hit the Floor

text.last_approved_text: The Druchii do not contemplate peace; there can only be war without end. Whenever the Dark Elves are not at war, they are contemplating their next conflict. The desire to destroy is absolute; it courses through the Druchii's veins.

mission_text.text: The Druchii do not contemplate peace; there can only be war without end. Whenever the Dark Elves are not at war, they are contemplating their next conflict. The desire to destroy is absolute; it courses through the Druchii's veins.

text.last_approved_text: War Eternal

mission_text.text: War Eternal

text.last_approved_text: The chattel of war process from the battlefield to serve the Dark Elves dark desires. All of them are marked for death, the only variable is the manner of their demise, and how long their bodies will endure before giving in to sweet release.

mission_text.text: The chattel of war process from the battlefield to serve the Dark Elves dark desires. All of them are marked for death, the only variable is the manner of their demise, and how long their bodies will endure before giving in to sweet release.

text.last_approved_text: Those Who Wither

mission_text.text: Those Who Wither

text.last_approved_text: Malekith once tried to destroy the world, and he will do so again. He sees nobody but himself fit to rule over the land and, having been spurned by the one throne he desires, is now fixated on tearing it apart - the ultimate act of revenge.

mission_text.text: Malekith once tried to destroy the world, and he will do so again. He sees nobody but himself fit to rule over the land and, having been spurned by the one throne he desires, is now fixated on tearing it apart - the ultimate act of revenge.

text.last_approved_text: King of Cinders

mission_text.text: King of Cinders

text.last_approved_text: The War Hydra is one of the largest beasts in all of Naggaroth. Each of its many heads is cantankerous and violent, and powerful is the army who tames one of these beasts. The beasts are so furious and unpredictable, that many Druchii armies choose instead to avoid them altogether.

mission_text.text: The War Hydra is one of the largest beasts in all of Naggaroth. Each of its many heads is cantankerous and violent, and powerful is the army who tames one of these beasts. The beasts are so furious and unpredictable, that many Druchii armies choose instead to avoid them altogether.

text.last_approved_text: Many Heads Are Better

mission_text.text: Many Heads Are Better

text.last_approved_text: Druchii deal in death; it is their strongest and most dependable currency. Each battlefield is a masterpiece of massacre; bodies fall by the droves before the unflinchingly savage attacks of the Merciless Host.

mission_text.text: Druchii deal in death; it is their strongest and most dependable currency. Each battlefield is a masterpiece of massacre; bodies fall by the droves before the unflinchingly savage attacks of the Merciless Host.

text.last_approved_text: Endless Bloodlust

mission_text.text: Endless Bloodlust

text.last_approved_text: The world must come tumbling down, and no Druchii ever saw peace as a viable means to do so. Destruction is not so much a conscious choice of the Dark Elves as it is a primordial desire.

mission_text.text: The world must come tumbling down, and no Druchii ever saw peace as a viable means to do so. Destruction is not so much a conscious choice of the Dark Elves as it is a primordial desire.

text.last_approved_text: Give War a Chance

mission_text.text: Give War a Chance

text.last_approved_text: Strength over others is the mantra of the Dark Elves, and what better way to demonstrate absolute power over another than by enslaving them? The defeated survivors of battle are made to work for their new Druchii overlords, until the punishing pace finally kills them.

mission_text.text: Strength over others is the mantra of the Dark Elves, and what better way to demonstrate absolute power over another than by enslaving them? The defeated survivors of battle are made to work for their new Druchii overlords, until the punishing pace finally kills them.

text.last_approved_text: Those Who Die

mission_text.text: Those Who Die

text.last_approved_text: Malekith will be ascendant in this life or the next. That the Phoenix Crown is beyond his reach now is known, yet there are other thrones upon which he may yet sit. A throne of cinders, as the world burns, seems most appealing to him.

mission_text.text: Malekith will be ascendant in this life or the next. That the Phoenix Crown is beyond his reach now is known, yet there are other thrones upon which he may yet sit. A throne of cinders, as the world burns, seems most appealing to him.

text.last_approved_text: The Witch King Rises

mission_text.text: The Witch King Rises

text.last_approved_text: The Slann Mage-Priests are custodians of the Lizardmen: a duty charged to them by the Old Ones, many millennia ago. It falls to the Slann, then, and Mazdamundi as chief amongst them, to see the Lizardmen unified under the Old One's vision; his vision.

mission_text.text: The Slann Mage-Priests are custodians of the Lizardmen: a duty charged to them by the Old Ones, many millennia ago. It falls to the Slann, then, and Mazdamundi as chief amongst them, to see the Lizardmen unified under the Old One's vision; his vision.

text.last_approved_text: The Plan Realised

mission_text.text: The Plan Realised

text.last_approved_text: Since the Old Ones departed, and the calamitous coming of Chaos, the Lizardmen have ever waged war. Both as defenders and as invaders, the Lizardmen have prosecuted the Old One's desires, protecting Lustria - and indeed the world - as decreed by Mazdamundi.

mission_text.text: Since the Old Ones departed, and the calamitous coming of Chaos, the Lizardmen have ever waged war. Both as defenders and as invaders, the Lizardmen have prosecuted the Old One's desires, protecting Lustria - and indeed the world - as decreed by Mazdamundi.

text.last_approved_text: Let Sleeping Slann Lie

mission_text.text: Let Sleeping Slann Lie

text.last_approved_text: Lizardmen history is littered with the mighty exploits of noble individuals that helped staunch the tide of Chaos; true heroes of Lustria. These noble warriors must surely be a part of the Great Plan, born to enact the Old One's will.

mission_text.text: Lizardmen history is littered with the mighty exploits of noble individuals that helped staunch the tide of Chaos; true heroes of Lustria. These noble warriors must surely be a part of the Great Plan, born to enact the Old One's will.

text.last_approved_text: I Need a Hero

mission_text.text: I Need a Hero

text.last_approved_text: At the apex of the towering Lizardmen pyramids, the star chambers allow the Slann to see view the span of the cosmos. Through celestial observation, the mage priests see what was, what is, and what might be.

mission_text.text: At the apex of the towering Lizardmen pyramids, the star chambers allow the Slann to see view the span of the cosmos. Through celestial observation, the mage priests see what was, what is, and what might be.

text.last_approved_text: To The Moon!

mission_text.text: To The Moon!

text.last_approved_text: As time makes a chasm between the Old Ones and the Slann, the Great Plan of their forebears becomes obfuscated and blurry. Yet Mazdamundi knows that evil dwells in all places, and Chaos lurks, ever-ready, so the Lizardmen must seek it out and destroy it, wherever it emerges.

mission_text.text: As time makes a chasm between the Old Ones and the Slann, the Great Plan of their forebears becomes obfuscated and blurry. Yet Mazdamundi knows that evil dwells in all places, and Chaos lurks, ever-ready, so the Lizardmen must seek it out and destroy it, wherever it emerges.

text.last_approved_text: A Time of Vast Battles

mission_text.text: A Time of Vast Battles

text.last_approved_text: Chaos are the eternal enemies of all, but no more so than the Lizardmen. Mazdamundi knows their threatening evil more than most, and knows only Lizardmen unity in the face of this onslaught can hope to overcome the torrent of maleficence.

mission_text.text: Chaos are the eternal enemies of all, but no more so than the Lizardmen. Mazdamundi knows their threatening evil more than most, and knows only Lizardmen unity in the face of this onslaught can hope to overcome the torrent of maleficence.

text.last_approved_text: The Plan Above All

mission_text.text: The Plan Above All

text.last_approved_text: Lustria is beset by foolish man and filthy Skaven, all of who encroach upon the hallowed and sacred lands of the Lizardmen. They bring with them corruption and deception. There is no place for them amongst the jungles. They must all be purged.

mission_text.text: Lustria is beset by foolish man and filthy Skaven, all of who encroach upon the hallowed and sacred lands of the Lizardmen. They bring with them corruption and deception. There is no place for them amongst the jungles. They must all be purged.

text.last_approved_text: The Will of the Old Ones

mission_text.text: The Will of the Old Ones

text.last_approved_text: Though the Slann Mage-Priests are wise, they prove difficult to understand. The Slann speak telepathically, and are often locked in meditative trances. Only the Skink Priests, through great effort, are able to commune with their masters and divine their will.

mission_text.text: Though the Slann Mage-Priests are wise, they prove difficult to understand. The Slann speak telepathically, and are often locked in meditative trances. Only the Skink Priests, through great effort, are able to commune with their masters and divine their will.

text.last_approved_text: So Sure, Sotek

mission_text.text: So Sure, Sotek

text.last_approved_text: As the Old Ones emerged from the heavens, so too did they return there. From the star chambers, the sweeping arc of the cosmos reveals itself to the Slann, that they might observe and, with the grace of transcendental wisdom, understand.

mission_text.text: As the Old Ones emerged from the heavens, so too did they return there. From the star chambers, the sweeping arc of the cosmos reveals itself to the Slann, that they might observe and, with the grace of transcendental wisdom, understand.

text.last_approved_text: The Mysteries of the Universe

mission_text.text: The Mysteries of the Universe

text.last_approved_text: The Lizardmen are constantly beset by those who would see them and their ways undone. So many temples lie in ruins, as the forces of Chaos - or man, or some other destructive ilk - have been allowed to run rampant. War can only be answered with war.

mission_text.text: The Lizardmen are constantly beset by those who would see them and their ways undone. So many temples lie in ruins, as the forces of Chaos - or man, or some other destructive ilk - have been allowed to run rampant. War can only be answered with war.

text.last_approved_text: Primordial War

mission_text.text: Primordial War

text.last_approved_text: Lustria was once ascendant - a jungle paradise where all Lizardmen worked harmoniously together for a common purpose, under the watchful eye of the Old Ones. This can be so again; but the Lizardmen must come together now beneath the curious minds of the Slann.

mission_text.text: Lustria was once ascendant - a jungle paradise where all Lizardmen worked harmoniously together for a common purpose, under the watchful eye of the Old Ones. This can be so again; but the Lizardmen must come together now beneath the curious minds of the Slann.

text.last_approved_text: A Legacy Regained

mission_text.text: A Legacy Regained

text.last_approved_text: The Lizardmen are powerful combatants, and the magical might of the Slann is beyond comprehension. Whilst Skinks and Saurus warriors dive headlong into the fray, the Mage-Priests summon spells that can rend the very mountains asunder, assaulting their foes with the very fury of the Old Ones.

mission_text.text: The Lizardmen are powerful combatants, and the magical might of the Slann is beyond comprehension. Whilst Skinks and Saurus warriors dive headlong into the fray, the Mage-Priests summon spells that can rend the very mountains asunder, assaulting their foes with the very fury of the Old Ones.

text.last_approved_text: The Plan Demands

mission_text.text: The Plan Demands

text.last_approved_text: The disappearance of the Old Ones taught the Lizardmen one thing - they cannot exist without leaders, without direction. And so leaders must emerge, both wise mage-priest and mighty warriors, to drive the Lizardmen forward, to ever greater glory.

mission_text.text: The disappearance of the Old Ones taught the Lizardmen one thing - they cannot exist without leaders, without direction. And so leaders must emerge, both wise mage-priest and mighty warriors, to drive the Lizardmen forward, to ever greater glory.

text.last_approved_text: Executors of the Plan

mission_text.text: Executors of the Plan

text.last_approved_text: To the unobservant, the stars in the sky seems unconnected and disparate; simply floating gems in the tapestry of night. The Slann know otherwise. The stars weave a pattern of history and prophecy; through these observations, they will gain clarity and purpose.

mission_text.text: To the unobservant, the stars in the sky seems unconnected and disparate; simply floating gems in the tapestry of night. The Slann know otherwise. The stars weave a pattern of history and prophecy; through these observations, they will gain clarity and purpose.

text.last_approved_text: The Constellation Game

mission_text.text: The Constellation Game

text.last_approved_text: The fracturing of Lustria in the Great Catastrophe left the Lizardmen disparate, with many tribes feeling bereft and alone. Unification and reconquest of lost Lustrian lands is chief amongst the Slann's designs, as part of fulfilling the Old One's Great Plan.

mission_text.text: The fracturing of Lustria in the Great Catastrophe left the Lizardmen disparate, with many tribes feeling bereft and alone. Unification and reconquest of lost Lustrian lands is chief amongst the Slann's designs, as part of fulfilling the Old One's Great Plan.

text.last_approved_text: Lustria? I Hardly Know Her!

mission_text.text: Lustria? I Hardly Know Her!

text.last_approved_text: United, the Lizardmen are a force beyond defeat; a singular vision striking forth with military master; a scourge to all their enemies. Divided, however, they are no more than scurrying amphibians. They must find their unified grit once again.

mission_text.text: United, the Lizardmen are a force beyond defeat; a singular vision striking forth with military master; a scourge to all their enemies. Divided, however, they are no more than scurrying amphibians. They must find their unified grit once again.

text.last_approved_text: All for One

mission_text.text: All for One

text.last_approved_text: Battle is in the Lizardmen's blood. From the tenacious anger of the Skinks, to the charging fury of the Troglodons, they are evolved for war. And so war they shall have, in the name of Lustria.

mission_text.text: Battle is in the Lizardmen's blood. From the tenacious anger of the Skinks, to the charging fury of the Troglodons, they are evolved for war. And so war they shall have, in the name of Lustria.

text.last_approved_text: Jungle Fever

mission_text.text: Jungle Fever

text.last_approved_text: The Great Plan is not something that all Lizardmen innately know. It is handed down from the Slann to their Skink Priests, and then to the rest. Lizardmen rely on great leaders and prophets to guide their actions.

mission_text.text: The Great Plan is not something that all Lizardmen innately know. It is handed down from the Slann to their Skink Priests, and then to the rest. Lizardmen rely on great leaders and prophets to guide their actions.

text.last_approved_text: Lizardly Leaders

mission_text.text: Lizardly Leaders

text.last_approved_text: The Slann desire above all to receive some word from the Old Ones again; to know they are not totally abandoned. They have raised great structures of communication and contemplation across Lustria to this end; The Ziggurat of Dawn, the Sentinels of Xeti and, of course, myriad star chambers.

mission_text.text: The Slann desire above all to receive some word from the Old Ones again; to know they are not totally abandoned. They have raised great structures of communication and contemplation across Lustria to this end; The Ziggurat of Dawn, the Sentinels of Xeti and, of course, myriad star chambers.

text.last_approved_text: When You Wish Upon a Star

mission_text.text: When You Wish Upon a Star

text.last_approved_text: There is no plan but the Great Plan. No way but the Lizardman way. No path but the one that Mazdamundi has set upon. Lustria must unify, Mazdamundi must reign, the Plan must succeed!

mission_text.text: There is no plan but the Great Plan. No way but the Lizardman way. No path but the one that Mazdamundi has set upon. Lustria must unify, Mazdamundi must reign, the Plan must succeed!

text.last_approved_text: Temple Run

mission_text.text: Temple Run

text.last_approved_text: Lizardmen fighting Lizardmen is an ugly thing for the Slann to watch, but it is a symptom of the shattering effects of the Great Catastrophe. Pride is a powerful weapon, and it is one Mazdamundi must harness if he is to bring the Lizardmen together.

mission_text.text: Lizardmen fighting Lizardmen is an ugly thing for the Slann to watch, but it is a symptom of the shattering effects of the Great Catastrophe. Pride is a powerful weapon, and it is one Mazdamundi must harness if he is to bring the Lizardmen together.

text.last_approved_text: All Together Now

mission_text.text: All Together Now

text.last_approved_text: The Lizardmen are not deliberately malicious creatures, like the Skaven or their northern enemies, the Dark Elves. However, they care not for the machinations of others, only the realisation of their Great Plan. Anyone foolish enough to interfere faces the full fury of the Lustrians.

mission_text.text: The Lizardmen are not deliberately malicious creatures, like the Skaven or their northern enemies, the Dark Elves. However, they care not for the machinations of others, only the realisation of their Great Plan. Anyone foolish enough to interfere faces the full fury of the Lustrians.
Cold-Blooded

text.last_approved_text: The power of Mazdamundi is said to be beyond any mortal understanding. He can rip apart mountain ranges and detonate volcanoes if his power is left unchecked. Truly he, above all other mage-priests, is fit to lead the Lizardmen to war.

mission_text.text: The power of Mazdamundi is said to be beyond any mortal understanding. He can rip apart mountain ranges and detonate volcanoes if his power is left unchecked. Truly he, above all other mage-priests, is fit to lead the Lizardmen to war.

text.last_approved_text: Upon His Enduring Throne

mission_text.text: Upon His Enduring Throne

text.last_approved_text: As Mazdamundi stares at the patchwork blanket of the cosmos, he must wonder if the Old Ones are still out there; if there is purpose to the Great Plan. He remembers them, so he cannot lose hope. They will return, and the Lizardmen will be ready.

mission_text.text: As Mazdamundi stares at the patchwork blanket of the cosmos, he must wonder if the Old Ones are still out there; if there is purpose to the Great Plan. He remembers them, so he cannot lose hope. They will return, and the Lizardmen will be ready.

text.last_approved_text: My God, It's Full of Stars

mission_text.text: My God, It's Full of Stars

text.last_approved_text: From Hexoatl in Isthmus, to Xlanzec in the south, all of Lustria belongs to the Lizardmen. Or, at least, it should. No force can be permitted to halt Mazdamundi's advance. The Lizardmen will unify, or die!

mission_text.text: From Hexoatl in Isthmus, to Xlanzec in the south, all of Lustria belongs to the Lizardmen. Or, at least, it should. No force can be permitted to halt Mazdamundi's advance. The Lizardmen will unify, or die!

text.last_approved_text: A Lustria for Power

mission_text.text: A Lustria for Power

text.last_approved_text: To the Elves, Khaine is the God of War. However, to the Druchii, he more specifically embodies murder, hatred and destruction. When creating rituals, it is to Khaine that the Druchii send their most ardent requests.

mission_text.text: To the Elves, Khaine is the God of War. However, to the Druchii, he more specifically embodies murder, hatred and destruction. When creating rituals, it is to Khaine that the Druchii send their most ardent requests.

text.last_approved_text: The Bloody-Handed God

mission_text.text: The Bloody-Handed God

text.last_approved_text: Morathi is a schemer and a plotter. What she does in the shadows maintains the Dark Elves, though few would ever know. Whilst others fight great wars, Morathi stalks the shadows, manipulating the strings of fate between her fingers.
