mission_text.text: Morathi is a schemer and a plotter. What she does in the shadows maintains the Dark Elves, though few would ever know. Whilst others fight great wars, Morathi stalks the shadows, manipulating the strings of fate between her fingers.

text.last_approved_text: By Hook or By Crook

mission_text.text: By Hook or By Crook

text.last_approved_text: There is no shortage of Dark Elves wishing to make a name for themselves; great warriors vying to be powerful and renowned. Those that survive the murderous rat race, then, are truly the mightiest.

mission_text.text: There is no shortage of Dark Elves wishing to make a name for themselves; great warriors vying to be powerful and renowned. Those that survive the murderous rat race, then, are truly the mightiest.

text.last_approved_text: Made Men

mission_text.text: Made Men

text.last_approved_text: To be imprisoned by the armies of the Witch King is a fate nobody would wish on his worst enemy. Thralls of the Druchii are subjected to back-breaking labour and torture. It is a blessed mercy to be killed early, and swiftly.

mission_text.text: To be imprisoned by the armies of the Witch King is a fate nobody would wish on his worst enemy. Thralls of the Druchii are subjected to back-breaking labour and torture. It is a blessed mercy to be killed early, and swiftly.

text.last_approved_text: Those Who Serve

mission_text.text: Those Who Serve

text.last_approved_text: Naggaroth is a cold and desolate range of gnarled mountains and inhospitable climes. It is a perfect reflection of the soul of the Druchii, and Morathi will claim it for them.

mission_text.text: Naggaroth is a cold and desolate range of gnarled mountains and inhospitable climes. It is a perfect reflection of the soul of the Druchii, and Morathi will claim it for them.

text.last_approved_text: Mountainous Feats

mission_text.text: Mountainous Feats

text.last_approved_text: The six-armed goddess Hekarti is the deity of magic and conjuration. She sees the Winds of Magic and bends them to her will. To pray to Hekarti is to desire magical power above all else.

mission_text.text: The six-armed goddess Hekarti is the deity of magic and conjuration. She sees the Winds of Magic and bends them to her will. To pray to Hekarti is to desire magical power above all else.

text.last_approved_text: Shot Through Hekarti

mission_text.text: Shot Through Hekarti

text.last_approved_text: In the darkness, Morathi thrives. It is said that she has done much and more to keep Malekith alive and in power than even Malekith himself. She holds the Druchii together, when otherwise they would tear themselves apart.

mission_text.text: In the darkness, Morathi thrives. It is said that she has done much and more to keep Malekith alive and in power than even Malekith himself. She holds the Druchii together, when otherwise they would tear themselves apart.

text.last_approved_text: Morathi's Way

mission_text.text: Morathi's Way

text.last_approved_text: Murder is no stranger to the Druchii; subterfuge and assassination are as much a part of their lives as open battle and bloodshed. Strength is the only determining factor, and nobody can be powerful when they are dead.

mission_text.text: Murder is no stranger to the Druchii; subterfuge and assassination are as much a part of their lives as open battle and bloodshed. Strength is the only determining factor, and nobody can be powerful when they are dead.

text.last_approved_text: What We Do In the Shadows

mission_text.text: What We Do In the Shadows

text.last_approved_text: Every slave taken by Malekith strengthens his fight against the High Elves. Each and every man taken provides strength to the Druchii, through manual labour or simply the sport of having them killed.

mission_text.text: Every slave taken by Malekith strengthens his fight against the High Elves. Each and every man taken provides strength to the Druchii, through manual labour or simply the sport of having them killed.

text.last_approved_text: Those Who Suffer

mission_text.text: Those Who Suffer

text.last_approved_text: The Dark Elves came to Naggaroth from the ocean, borne by their titanic Black Arks. The sea is familiar to them, and Mathlann provides for those obedient servants.

mission_text.text: The Dark Elves came to Naggaroth from the ocean, borne by their titanic Black Arks. The sea is familiar to them, and Mathlann provides for those obedient servants.

text.last_approved_text: Coast to Coast

mission_text.text: Coast to Coast

text.last_approved_text: The God of the Sea, Mathlann, provides grace and safety to those Elves caught on the waves. Much like the tumultuous ocean, however, Mathlann is fickle and capricious; he is as like to smash a ship asunder as he is to see it safely to shore.

mission_text.text: The God of the Sea, Mathlann, provides grace and safety to those Elves caught on the waves. Much like the tumultuous ocean, however, Mathlann is fickle and capricious; he is as like to smash a ship asunder as he is to see it safely to shore.

text.last_approved_text: Beyond the Sea

mission_text.text: Beyond the Sea

text.last_approved_text: Morathi has taught Malekith everything she knows over centuries of toil and determination. Her desire to see her son succeed burns obsessively within her. She will unify the Druchii for him, or she will see them destroyed.

mission_text.text: Morathi has taught Malekith everything she knows over centuries of toil and determination. Her desire to see her son succeed burns obsessively within her. She will unify the Druchii for him, or she will see them destroyed.

text.last_approved_text: Friends Close…

mission_text.text: Friends Close…

text.last_approved_text: The Tyrants of Naggaroth lead armies into battle through raw strength; no other can lead because no other has the strength. It can be assured, therefore, that an army is in capable hands by the amount of others who died vying for that same role.

mission_text.text: The Tyrants of Naggaroth lead armies into battle through raw strength; no other can lead because no other has the strength. It can be assured, therefore, that an army is in capable hands by the amount of others who died vying for that same role.

text.last_approved_text: The Strongest Survive

mission_text.text: The Strongest Survive

text.last_approved_text: The Dark Elves are merciless creatures but there is certainly a practical use in not killing every survivor of battle. Whilst scores of them will be executed, of course, others will be put to work. The labour will eventually kill them, naturally.

mission_text.text: The Dark Elves are merciless creatures but there is certainly a practical use in not killing every survivor of battle. Whilst scores of them will be executed, of course, others will be put to work. The labour will eventually kill them, naturally.

text.last_approved_text: Those Who Toil

mission_text.text: Those Who Toil

text.last_approved_text: To the south of Naggaroth, the climate changes sharply to a dense and humid tropic. The jungles of Lustria are teeming with ruined temples and territorial Lizardmen, but ultimately the Druchii will claim what they desire.

mission_text.text: To the south of Naggaroth, the climate changes sharply to a dense and humid tropic. The jungles of Lustria are teeming with ruined temples and territorial Lizardmen, but ultimately the Druchii will claim what they desire.

text.last_approved_text: Jungle's Call

mission_text.text: Jungle's Call

text.last_approved_text: Atharti is the Elven Goddess of Seduction and Pleasure, which the Druchii are more than happy to give themselves over to. To invoke the Lady of Desire is to wholeheartedly pray for the corruption of their enemies; specifically, to break the unflinchingly uptight hearts of the High Elves.

mission_text.text: Atharti is the Elven Goddess of Seduction and Pleasure, which the Druchii are more than happy to give themselves over to. To invoke the Lady of Desire is to wholeheartedly pray for the corruption of their enemies; specifically, to break the unflinchingly uptight hearts of the High Elves.

text.last_approved_text: What Atharti Wants Atharti Gets

mission_text.text: What Atharti Wants Atharti Gets

text.last_approved_text: It is said, in hushed whispers, that Morathi would do anything to see Malekith's wishes fulfilled. It is said, in even more hushed whispers, that should her son fall in battle, she would most certainly see the world obliterated as an act of maternal revenge.

mission_text.text: It is said, in hushed whispers, that Morathi would do anything to see Malekith's wishes fulfilled. It is said, in even more hushed whispers, that should her son fall in battle, she would most certainly see the world obliterated as an act of maternal revenge.

text.last_approved_text: House of Shards

mission_text.text: House of Shards

text.last_approved_text: Treachery comes as easily to the Dark Elves as breathing; skulduggery and dark dealings are a means to an end for many power-hungry and conniving Lords. A well-placed knife in the dark can be more powerful than a thousand arrows on the battlefield.

mission_text.text: Treachery comes as easily to the Dark Elves as breathing; skulduggery and dark dealings are a means to an end for many power-hungry and conniving Lords. A well-placed knife in the dark can be more powerful than a thousand arrows on the battlefield.

text.last_approved_text: The Third Way

mission_text.text: The Third Way

text.last_approved_text: The chattel of war process from the battlefield to serve the Dark Elves' macabre desires. All of them are marked for death, the only variable is the manner of their demise, and how long their bodies will endure before giving in to sweet release.

mission_text.text: The chattel of war process from the battlefield to serve the Dark Elves' macabre desires. All of them are marked for death, the only variable is the manner of their demise, and how long their bodies will endure before giving in to sweet release.

text.last_approved_text: Those Who Wither

mission_text.text: Those Who Wither

text.last_approved_text: Lustria could not be any more different from Naggaroth; lush and tropical jungles stand in stark contrast the barren, frigid wastes. Though Lustria is humid and sticky, the Druchii must look covetously upon it all the same.

mission_text.text: Lustria could not be any more different from Naggaroth; lush and tropical jungles stand in stark contrast the barren, frigid wastes. Though Lustria is humid and sticky, the Druchii must look covetously upon it all the same.

text.last_approved_text: Out of the Fire

mission_text.text: Out of the Fire

text.last_approved_text: The dark invocations of the Druchii are uttered to bring about a single purpose - the destruction of their most hated of foes, the High Elves. The gods of the Elven pantheon are watching, and grant their favour only to the most devout.

mission_text.text: The dark invocations of the Druchii are uttered to bring about a single purpose - the destruction of their most hated of foes, the High Elves. The gods of the Elven pantheon are watching, and grant their favour only to the most devout.

text.last_approved_text: Rich in Rituals

mission_text.text: Rich in Rituals

text.last_approved_text: Morathi understands the power of words to get her way. In the shadows, away from the prying eyes, she works tirelessly to maintain her shadowy grip on the Druchii. Malekith should be thankful she is loyal to him, for otherwise she would surely be ascendant.

mission_text.text: Morathi understands the power of words to get her way. In the shadows, away from the prying eyes, she works tirelessly to maintain her shadowy grip on the Druchii. Malekith should be thankful she is loyal to him, for otherwise she would surely be ascendant.

text.last_approved_text: You Heard The Woman!

mission_text.text: You Heard The Woman!

text.last_approved_text: Many of the greatest names of the Druchii owe a great debt to their familial names. Without them, so many 'great' Dark Elves would be nothing more than lesser nobles, squabbling with the others to simply stand near to their superiors.

mission_text.text: Many of the greatest names of the Druchii owe a great debt to their familial names. Without them, so many 'great' Dark Elves would be nothing more than lesser nobles, squabbling with the others to simply stand near to their superiors.

text.last_approved_text: Those Who Would Be King

mission_text.text: Those Who Would Be King

text.last_approved_text: The chattel of war process from the battlefield to serve the Dark Elves dark desires. All of them are marked for death, the only variable is the manner of their demise, and how long their bodies will endure before giving in to sweet release.

mission_text.text: The chattel of war process from the battlefield to serve the Dark Elves dark desires. All of them are marked for death, the only variable is the manner of their demise, and how long their bodies will endure before giving in to sweet release.

text.last_approved_text: Those Who Die

mission_text.text: Those Who Die

text.last_approved_text: It is the will of the Druchii to dominate, it is in their very blood. That they share Naggaroth with insolent barbarians is bad enough, but an entire, lush land to their south, inhabited by pestilent natives? This cannot stand.

mission_text.text: It is the will of the Druchii to dominate, it is in their very blood. That they share Naggaroth with insolent barbarians is bad enough, but an entire, lush land to their south, inhabited by pestilent natives? This cannot stand.

text.last_approved_text: Everything The Light Touches

mission_text.text: Everything The Light Touches

text.last_approved_text: Queek Headtaker is arguably the most powerful Skaven in the thirteen clans. His rise to power is built on butchery and cruelty without cessation, and an unrivalled rage that drives him ever onwards.

mission_text.text: Queek Headtaker is arguably the most powerful Skaven in the thirteen clans. His rise to power is built on butchery and cruelty without cessation, and an unrivalled rage that drives him ever onwards.

text.last_approved_text: Queek as Folk

mission_text.text: Queek as Folk

text.last_approved_text: The bulk of Queek's achievements were scored underground, against rival clans and Dwarfen expeditions. Those who follow him now know that he will surely replicate these barbaric successes on the surface.

mission_text.text: The bulk of Queek's achievements were scored underground, against rival clans and Dwarfen expeditions. Those who follow him now know that he will surely replicate these barbaric successes on the surface.

text.last_approved_text: Ah, Rats!

mission_text.text: Ah, Rats!

text.last_approved_text: All Skaven are greedy, self-interested bundles of furry ego. Their desire for strength and wealth almost outweighs their desire for bloodshed and destruction. Yet even in the midst of bloodlust, the price of war must be paid.

mission_text.text: All Skaven are greedy, self-interested bundles of furry ego. Their desire for strength and wealth almost outweighs their desire for bloodshed and destruction. Yet even in the midst of bloodlust, the price of war must be paid.

text.last_approved_text: Plunder & Lightning

mission_text.text: Plunder & Lightning

text.last_approved_text: They speak of Skaven in hushed tones on the surface, so unwilling are people to believe that an apocalyptic threat exists beneath their feet. Those that are vanish in the lightning Skaven raids are never spoken of again. To discuss it is to give those nasty rumours credence...

mission_text.text: They speak of Skaven in hushed tones on the surface, so unwilling are people to believe that an apocalyptic threat exists beneath their feet. Those that are vanish in the lightning Skaven raids are never spoken of again. To discuss it is to give those nasty rumours credence...

text.last_approved_text: Skaven's Slaves

mission_text.text: Skaven's Slaves

text.last_approved_text: Queek Headtaker, as the 'trusted' general of Warlord Gnawdwell, is dispatched on missions at his master's leisure. Such affairs keep Queek occupied and, so Gnawdwell believes, stops him from plotting to take his position.

mission_text.text: Queek Headtaker, as the 'trusted' general of Warlord Gnawdwell, is dispatched on missions at his master's leisure. Such affairs keep Queek occupied and, so Gnawdwell believes, stops him from plotting to take his position.

text.last_approved_text: Gnaw Do Well

mission_text.text: Gnaw Do Well

text.last_approved_text: Queek is accompanied in most battles by his elite cadre of Stormvermin, clad in recognisable blood-scarlet robes. However, Queek likes nothing more than to get amongst the throng and cause wanton death and bloodshed personally.

mission_text.text: Queek is accompanied in most battles by his elite cadre of Stormvermin, clad in recognisable blood-scarlet robes. However, Queek likes nothing more than to get amongst the throng and cause wanton death and bloodshed personally.

text.last_approved_text: Head & Shoulders

mission_text.text: Head & Shoulders

text.last_approved_text: Queek Headtaker's prowess in the Underway is so legendary that they call him the Dwarf-Smiter. So cruel is his torture of his victims that they call him the Headtaker. Yet he is ultimately just Queek, the Skaven warrior par excellence, always hungry for the next battle.

mission_text.text: Queek Headtaker's prowess in the Underway is so legendary that they call him the Dwarf-Smiter. So cruel is his torture of his victims that they call him the Headtaker. Yet he is ultimately just Queek, the Skaven warrior par excellence, always hungry for the next battle.

text.last_approved_text: Relentless Rat Risings

mission_text.text: Relentless Rat Risings

text.last_approved_text: The Skaven are ingenious engineers, always finding new and terrifying ways to wage war. Be it the creation of new weapons, or dangerous Warpstone alchemy, the Skaven are unafraid to risk everything in the name of an edge in the next battle.

mission_text.text: The Skaven are ingenious engineers, always finding new and terrifying ways to wage war. Be it the creation of new weapons, or dangerous Warpstone alchemy, the Skaven are unafraid to risk everything in the name of an edge in the next battle.

text.last_approved_text: Claws For Thought

mission_text.text: Claws For Thought

text.last_approved_text: Queek's cruelty is so vast that he demands trophies from his battles. Vast numbers of captives are taken from the battlefields to serve as slaves for the Skaven armies. Those that attract his ire, however, soon find themselves several inches shorter…

mission_text.text: Queek's cruelty is so vast that he demands trophies from his battles. Vast numbers of captives are taken from the battlefields to serve as slaves for the Skaven armies. Those that attract his ire, however, soon find themselves several inches shorter…

text.last_approved_text: Slave (For You)

mission_text.text: Slave (For You)

text.last_approved_text: The Headtaker accepts any mission issued him by his overlords, for he knows it keeps him inconspicuous. Yet Queek did not rise to such a powerful position through subservience, oh no…

mission_text.text: The Headtaker accepts any mission issued him by his overlords, for he knows it keeps him inconspicuous. Yet Queek did not rise to such a powerful position through subservience, oh no…

text.last_approved_text: Listen to Your Elders

mission_text.text: Listen to Your Elders

text.last_approved_text: Queek Headtaker has achieved victory and glory through sheer tenacity. It is not he who led the attacks on the Karak Eight Peaks, but such was his sustained conviction and violence, he was granted first scavenge rights, essentially cementing him as the battle's legend.

mission_text.text: Queek Headtaker has achieved victory and glory through sheer tenacity. It is not he who led the attacks on the Karak Eight Peaks, but such was his sustained conviction and violence, he was granted first scavenge rights, essentially cementing him as the battle's legend.

text.last_approved_text: The Headtaker

mission_text.text: The Headtaker

text.last_approved_text: One does not get the epithet "Headtaker" or "Dwarf-Smiter" through paltry encounters. Queek has stormed to victory with a zeal that sends enemies fleeing for their lives, broken before the fury of the Warlord of Clan Mors.

mission_text.text: One does not get the epithet "Headtaker" or "Dwarf-Smiter" through paltry encounters. Queek has stormed to victory with a zeal that sends enemies fleeing for their lives, broken before the fury of the Warlord of Clan Mors.

text.last_approved_text: Squeaking Victory

mission_text.text: Squeaking Victory

text.last_approved_text: The Skaven take everything they want. Not content to play by the conventional methods of the surface-dwellers, the Skaven will swarm across the land, picking it dry and living off the spoils of war.

mission_text.text: The Skaven take everything they want. Not content to play by the conventional methods of the surface-dwellers, the Skaven will swarm across the land, picking it dry and living off the spoils of war.

text.last_approved_text: Raiding Places

mission_text.text: Raiding Places

text.last_approved_text: The trudge-trudge of slaves from a Skaven-blighted land is the sign that Queek Headtaker has visited destruction upon the surface. These poor souls will never been seen again for, if Queek does not take their heads as a prize, they will surely die beneath the surface.

mission_text.text: The trudge-trudge of slaves from a Skaven-blighted land is the sign that Queek Headtaker has visited destruction upon the surface. These poor souls will never been seen again for, if Queek does not take their heads as a prize, they will surely die beneath the surface.

text.last_approved_text: Man Servants

mission_text.text: Man Servants

text.last_approved_text: Queek is not a rat who denies a challenge, be that from his enemies or from Warlord Gnawdwell himself. Whenever there is glory to be gained, Queek will be there, ripping apart any who would deny him.

mission_text.text: Queek is not a rat who denies a challenge, be that from his enemies or from Warlord Gnawdwell himself. Whenever there is glory to be gained, Queek will be there, ripping apart any who would deny him.

text.last_approved_text: As You Command

mission_text.text: As You Command

text.last_approved_text: To say that Gnawdwell relies on Queek would be an understatement. Although the Warlord keeps Queek busy out of self-preservation, he is also paradoxically reliant on his underling's cruelty and barbaric success in battle.

mission_text.text: To say that Gnawdwell relies on Queek would be an understatement. Although the Warlord keeps Queek busy out of self-preservation, he is also paradoxically reliant on his underling's cruelty and barbaric success in battle.

text.last_approved_text: The Warlord Ascendant

mission_text.text: The Warlord Ascendant

text.last_approved_text: Even amongst the Skaven, Queek is renowned as unusually cruel. He takes endless delight in death and destruction, greedily slaking his hunger on countless enemies that fall to his frenzied attacks.

mission_text.text: Even amongst the Skaven, Queek is renowned as unusually cruel. He takes endless delight in death and destruction, greedily slaking his hunger on countless enemies that fall to his frenzied attacks.

text.last_approved_text: The Fall of Man

mission_text.text: The Fall of Man

text.last_approved_text: Behind their twitching snouts and glowing eyes, the Skaven possess cunning little brains, capable of devising ingenious and terrifying inventions. The engineers of the Skaven slave away below the surface, only emerging when they have something truly ingenious to display.

mission_text.text: Behind their twitching snouts and glowing eyes, the Skaven possess cunning little brains, capable of devising ingenious and terrifying inventions. The engineers of the Skaven slave away below the surface, only emerging when they have something truly ingenious to display.

text.last_approved_text: Lab Rats

mission_text.text: Lab Rats

text.last_approved_text: Though the Dwarfs are aware that the Skaven exist, the rest of the surface-dwellers refuse to accept it. Only the miserable, doomed slaves that get carted down to the Under-Empire know, but by then it is far too late…

mission_text.text: Though the Dwarfs are aware that the Skaven exist, the rest of the surface-dwellers refuse to accept it. Only the miserable, doomed slaves that get carted down to the Under-Empire know, but by then it is far too late…

text.last_approved_text: Unskilled Labour

mission_text.text: Unskilled Labour

text.last_approved_text: The only thing greater than Queek Headtaker's cruelty is his ego, which is immense. The lengths that the Warlord will go to for his own personal fulfilment is legendary, indicated by the trail of battered and bloodied Skaven corpses in his wake.

mission_text.text: The only thing greater than Queek Headtaker's cruelty is his ego, which is immense. The lengths that the Warlord will go to for his own personal fulfilment is legendary, indicated by the trail of battered and bloodied Skaven corpses in his wake.

text.last_approved_text: Ego Sum

mission_text.text: Ego Sum

text.last_approved_text: When Queek scurries to the battlefield, he does so with only one purpose; to destroy. No enemy can stand against his rage and his cruelty. When the fighting is done, and the battle is littered with enemy dead and dying, then Queek sets himself to feasting.

mission_text.text: When Queek scurries to the battlefield, he does so with only one purpose; to destroy. No enemy can stand against his rage and his cruelty. When the fighting is done, and the battle is littered with enemy dead and dying, then Queek sets himself to feasting.
Undisputed

text.last_approved_text: Throughout the Under-Empire, they speak with hushed respect of Queek Headtaker's deeds. For he is the Headtaker, the Dwarf-Smiter; scourge of the Underway, destroyer of Dwarfholds. His weapon, the Dwarf-Gouger, is forever stained with the blood of his foes.

mission_text.text: Throughout the Under-Empire, they speak with hushed respect of Queek Headtaker's deeds. For he is the Headtaker, the Dwarf-Smiter; scourge of the Underway, destroyer of Dwarfholds. His weapon, the Dwarf-Gouger, is forever stained with the blood of his foes.

text.last_approved_text: Queek the Cruel

mission_text.text: Queek the Cruel

text.last_approved_text: The Skaven take what they need, and indeed what they want, both from their enemies and from each other. The ratmen are not bound by conventional notions of property, and survive by stealing, raiding and coveting what they have to.

mission_text.text: The Skaven take what they need, and indeed what they want, both from their enemies and from each other. The ratmen are not bound by conventional notions of property, and survive by stealing, raiding and coveting what they have to.

text.last_approved_text: Ratman & Robbing

mission_text.text: Ratman & Robbing

text.last_approved_text: Those damned cretins dragged from their homes to be slaves for the ratmen await a fate worse than death. If the back-breaking labour doesn't kill them, the vile filth and pestilence of the Under-Empire will surely do for them eventually.

mission_text.text: Those damned cretins dragged from their homes to be slaves for the ratmen await a fate worse than death. If the back-breaking labour doesn't kill them, the vile filth and pestilence of the Under-Empire will surely do for them eventually.

text.last_approved_text: Army of Underlings

mission_text.text: Army of Underlings

text.last_approved_text: Let no Skaven say that Queek Headtaker is not an industrious leader. Though he always seeks glory and power, he has nevertheless led the Skaven to glory after glory in their eternal war against the surface-dwellers

mission_text.text: Let no Skaven say that Queek Headtaker is not an industrious leader. Though he always seeks glory and power, he has nevertheless led the Skaven to glory after glory in their eternal war against the surface-dwellers

text.last_approved_text: For the Good of One

mission_text.text: For the Good of One

text.last_approved_text: What Teclis lacks in physical prowess, he more than makes up for in intellect. Where Tyrion sees Ulthuan defended at the tip of a spear, Teclis sees the world sustained under magic and ideology. Thus, he endeavours to see his vision realised.

mission_text.text: What Teclis lacks in physical prowess, he more than makes up for in intellect. Where Tyrion sees Ulthuan defended at the tip of a spear, Teclis sees the world sustained under magic and ideology. Thus, he endeavours to see his vision realised.

text.last_approved_text: Brains Not Brawn

mission_text.text: Brains Not Brawn

text.last_approved_text: Hoeth is the Asur deity of wisdom and a patron of all those seeking greater knowledge. To pray to Hoeth when preparing a ritual is to ask for understanding.

mission_text.text: Hoeth is the Asur deity of wisdom and a patron of all those seeking greater knowledge. To pray to Hoeth when preparing a ritual is to ask for understanding.

text.last_approved_text: Hoeth & Pray

mission_text.text: Hoeth & Pray

text.last_approved_text: This is an age of destruction and desperation, where the people cry out for warriors of renown to defend them. Ulthuan must have those warriors, that would fight with Teclis in defence of Ulthuan, and the world!

mission_text.text: This is an age of destruction and desperation, where the people cry out for warriors of renown to defend them. Ulthuan must have those warriors, that would fight with Teclis in defence of Ulthuan, and the world!

text.last_approved_text: An Age of Legends

mission_text.text: An Age of Legends

text.last_approved_text: Teclis, unlike his brother, believes that the wider world has just as much import as Ulthuan. To this end, he has often struck out into the unexplored, to meet new civilisation and forge new bonds, so that through discussion and alliance, the world might be saved.

mission_text.text: Teclis, unlike his brother, believes that the wider world has just as much import as Ulthuan. To this end, he has often struck out into the unexplored, to meet new civilisation and forge new bonds, so that through discussion and alliance, the world might be saved.

text.last_approved_text: Elf Yourself

mission_text.text: Elf Yourself

text.last_approved_text: The Phoenix King speaks, and the High Elves listen. Teclis is sworn to carry out the whims of his king, and see the needs of the High Elves met. To this end, he scours the land in his liege's name.

mission_text.text: The Phoenix King speaks, and the High Elves listen. Teclis is sworn to carry out the whims of his king, and see the needs of the High Elves met. To this end, he scours the land in his liege's name.

text.last_approved_text: Whims of the Phoenix

mission_text.text: Whims of the Phoenix

text.last_approved_text: Teclis is responsible for furthering the learning and understanding of magic, not only in Ulthuan but throughout the world. To that end, he allied himself with Magnus the Pious, which in turn led to the establishment of the College of Magic, far away in the Empire.

mission_text.text: Teclis is responsible for furthering the learning and understanding of magic, not only in Ulthuan but throughout the world. To that end, he allied himself with Magnus the Pious, which in turn led to the establishment of the College of Magic, far away in the Empire.

text.last_approved_text: Teclis True

mission_text.text: Teclis True

text.last_approved_text: Vaul is the Elven patron of armour and blacksmithing. He was blinded during a battle with Khaine, who then enslaved the armourer. Vaul is a symbol of power to the Elves, and any invocation to his name is an attempt to channel that strength.

mission_text.text: Vaul is the Elven patron of armour and blacksmithing. He was blinded during a battle with Khaine, who then enslaved the armourer. Vaul is a symbol of power to the Elves, and any invocation to his name is an attempt to channel that strength.

text.last_approved_text: Vaul or Nothing

mission_text.text: Vaul or Nothing

text.last_approved_text: Teclis believes in the overbearing power of magic - and so he should, for it sustains his otherwise broken physical form. So powerful is Teclis, that it is said he could be greater perhaps than even the Necromancer, Nagash.

mission_text.text: Teclis believes in the overbearing power of magic - and so he should, for it sustains his otherwise broken physical form. So powerful is Teclis, that it is said he could be greater perhaps than even the Necromancer, Nagash.

text.last_approved_text: A Mage In Need

mission_text.text: A Mage In Need

text.last_approved_text: Teclis' travels have taken him far abroad, deeper into uncharted lands than any of the High Elves before him. His mission? To understand those he finds, and to locate strong and suitable partners to help him defeat Chaos.

mission_text.text: Teclis' travels have taken him far abroad, deeper into uncharted lands than any of the High Elves before him. His mission? To understand those he finds, and to locate strong and suitable partners to help him defeat Chaos.

text.last_approved_text: The Other Cheek

mission_text.text: The Other Cheek

text.last_approved_text: What the Phoenix King demands, Teclis delivers. He strikes out from coast to coast, encircling Ulthuan a dozen times over in his quest to rid Chaos and corruption from Asur shores. None shall stop him. Indeed, none can.

mission_text.text: What the Phoenix King demands, Teclis delivers. He strikes out from coast to coast, encircling Ulthuan a dozen times over in his quest to rid Chaos and corruption from Asur shores. None shall stop him. Indeed, none can.

text.last_approved_text: History Has Fixed Its Gaze Upon You

mission_text.text: History Has Fixed Its Gaze Upon You

text.last_approved_text: What Teclis does not already know, he will soon discover. His journeys outside of Ulthuan are fact-finding missions, and through his voyages he gains greater understanding of the world, and greater power with which to aid it.

mission_text.text: What Teclis does not already know, he will soon discover. His journeys outside of Ulthuan are fact-finding missions, and through his voyages he gains greater understanding of the world, and greater power with which to aid it.

text.last_approved_text: Knowledge is Power

mission_text.text: Knowledge is Power

text.last_approved_text: Asuryan is the masked ruler of the Elven pantheon; masked because his face has never been seen. He is chief justice of the Elves, and any invocation to him is to request the greatest of powers.

mission_text.text: Asuryan is the masked ruler of the Elven pantheon; masked because his face has never been seen. He is chief justice of the Elves, and any invocation to him is to request the greatest of powers.

text.last_approved_text: Pantheon's Call

mission_text.text: Pantheon's Call

text.last_approved_text: Teclis believes that through greater unity and understanding, and no small measure of force, Chaos will be relegated to oblivion and the enemies of Ulthuan will be destroyed. He is willing to learn from anyone who wishes to aid the High Elves in that endeavour.

mission_text.text: Teclis believes that through greater unity and understanding, and no small measure of force, Chaos will be relegated to oblivion and the enemies of Ulthuan will be destroyed. He is willing to learn from anyone who wishes to aid the High Elves in that endeavour.

text.last_approved_text: With Good Intentions

mission_text.text: With Good Intentions

text.last_approved_text: The world is wide, and Ulthuan is but a part of it. Yet it occupies a unique position at the centre of it all; this prime location makes it an excellent spot for trading, for those who have goods to sell.

mission_text.text: The world is wide, and Ulthuan is but a part of it. Yet it occupies a unique position at the centre of it all; this prime location makes it an excellent spot for trading, for those who have goods to sell.

text.last_approved_text: Goods, Heavens!

mission_text.text: Goods, Heavens!

text.last_approved_text: There is some deed to be done in every corner of Ulthuan. Since the Sundering, the land is beset by grim news and growing threats. These must be faced, confronted and solved, if Ulthuan is ever to know peace.

mission_text.text: There is some deed to be done in every corner of Ulthuan. Since the Sundering, the land is beset by grim news and growing threats. These must be faced, confronted and solved, if Ulthuan is ever to know peace.

text.last_approved_text: For the Sake of All

mission_text.text: For the Sake of All

text.last_approved_text: Understanding is key, or so Teclis believes. Understanding unlocks greater strength, which gives the High Elves the power to defeat their enemies and, beyond that, ensure the stability of the very world itself.

mission_text.text: Understanding is key, or so Teclis believes. Understanding unlocks greater strength, which gives the High Elves the power to defeat their enemies and, beyond that, ensure the stability of the very world itself.

text.last_approved_text: Half the Battle

mission_text.text: Half the Battle

text.last_approved_text: Isha is the Elven Goddess of Fertility, and protector of the natural order. Invocations to her are requests to preserve and maintain that which is, such as the Vortex, and save the world from an inexorable slide into destruction.

mission_text.text: Isha is the Elven Goddess of Fertility, and protector of the natural order. Invocations to her are requests to preserve and maintain that which is, such as the Vortex, and save the world from an inexorable slide into destruction.

text.last_approved_text: Isha Me!

mission_text.text: Isha Me!

text.last_approved_text: If the Phoenix King is to be successful in dragging Ulthuan from the recesses in which it languishes, he must be sure to have strong and capable leaders to help lead his forces. Only strong leadership can ensure a stable Ulthuan.

mission_text.text: If the Phoenix King is to be successful in dragging Ulthuan from the recesses in which it languishes, he must be sure to have strong and capable leaders to help lead his forces. Only strong leadership can ensure a stable Ulthuan.

text.last_approved_text: Elven Has Left the Building

mission_text.text: Elven Has Left the Building

text.last_approved_text: When Teclis marches to battle, he does so knowing that there are strong and dependable allies behind him. So it was in the Great War Against Chaos, when even soldiers from the Empire held fast with Teclis at their side.

mission_text.text: When Teclis marches to battle, he does so knowing that there are strong and dependable allies behind him. So it was in the Great War Against Chaos, when even soldiers from the Empire held fast with Teclis at their side.

text.last_approved_text: Strength in Numbers

mission_text.text: Strength in Numbers

text.last_approved_text: Everything must be for the greater good of Ulthuan; every task, no matter how trivial or seemingly insignificant, will be crucial. When the final history of Ulthuan is written, the epic deeds may be heralded, but the surety of the smaller deeds will never be forgotten.

mission_text.text: Everything must be for the greater good of Ulthuan; every task, no matter how trivial or seemingly insignificant, will be crucial. When the final history of Ulthuan is written, the epic deeds may be heralded, but the surety of the smaller deeds will never be forgotten.

text.last_approved_text: In His Name

mission_text.text: In His Name

text.last_approved_text: To believe that Teclis is the weaker of the two brothers would be a grave error. Tyrion certainly does not believe that to be so, and nor do Ulthuan's enemies. The power and knowledge contained within Teclis is something unseen for generations; a dark portent for all his enemies.

mission_text.text: To believe that Teclis is the weaker of the two brothers would be a grave error. Tyrion certainly does not believe that to be so, and nor do Ulthuan's enemies. The power and knowledge contained within Teclis is something unseen for generations; a dark portent for all his enemies.

text.last_approved_text: The Hunt for Knowledge

mission_text.text: The Hunt for Knowledge

text.last_approved_text: It is only through constant ritual and invocation that the High Elves maintain the world as it is. At the centre of Ulthuan, the Isle of the Dead hosts the Great Vortex, held in place by the channelled powers of dozens of High Elven mages, sustained forever in their work.

mission_text.text: It is only through constant ritual and invocation that the High Elves maintain the world as it is. At the centre of Ulthuan, the Isle of the Dead hosts the Great Vortex, held in place by the channelled powers of dozens of High Elven mages, sustained forever in their work.

text.last_approved_text: Isle Be Seeing You

mission_text.text: Isle Be Seeing You

text.last_approved_text: It is said that, since the Battle of Finuval Plains, Malekith himself takes great pains to avoid confrontation with his younger cousin, Teclis. For such is Teclis' gift for magic that even the Witch King considers him superior.

mission_text.text: It is said that, since the Battle of Finuval Plains, Malekith himself takes great pains to avoid confrontation with his younger cousin, Teclis. For such is Teclis' gift for magic that even the Witch King considers him superior.

text.last_approved_text: The Power Inside

mission_text.text: The Power Inside

text.last_approved_text: Teclis firmly believes that expansion of ideology, not isolation, is the key to Ulthuan's future. His journeys allow him to share wisdom with those he meets, and create meaningful connections that - he hopes - will make the world a better place.

mission_text.text: Teclis firmly believes that expansion of ideology, not isolation, is the key to Ulthuan's future. His journeys allow him to share wisdom with those he meets, and create meaningful connections that - he hopes - will make the world a better place.

text.last_approved_text: Ulthuan, United

mission_text.text: Ulthuan, United

text.last_approved_text: Ulthuan must be made pure, must be kept free of all corruption, if the Vortex is to be sustained and the world saved from destruction. To this end, every enemy must be crushed, every foe eradicated, and every whim of the Phoenix King met.

mission_text.text: Ulthuan must be made pure, must be kept free of all corruption, if the Vortex is to be sustained and the world saved from destruction. To this end, every enemy must be crushed, every foe eradicated, and every whim of the Phoenix King met.

text.last_approved_text: In the Name of the King

mission_text.text: In the Name of the King

text.last_approved_text: Prince Tyrion is the greatest living warrior of the High Elves, and stalwart defender of Ulthuan and the Everqueen. He wields armies as elegantly as a politician wields his words, calling the High Elves to his banner in the name of Ulthuan's defence.

mission_text.text: Prince Tyrion is the greatest living warrior of the High Elves, and stalwart defender of Ulthuan and the Everqueen. He wields armies as elegantly as a politician wields his words, calling the High Elves to his banner in the name of Ulthuan's defence.

text.last_approved_text: A Gracious Host

mission_text.text: A Gracious Host

text.last_approved_text: They say Tyrion has the ear of the Phoenix King, and is answerable to nobody but him. This favour gives him free range to take the fight to any he deems the enemies of Ulthuan, with unmatched martial prowess.

mission_text.text: They say Tyrion has the ear of the Phoenix King, and is answerable to nobody but him. This favour gives him free range to take the fight to any he deems the enemies of Ulthuan, with unmatched martial prowess.

text.last_approved_text: To the Fray!

mission_text.text: To the Fray!

text.last_approved_text: Tyrion is no politician, and would have floundered long ago were it not for the nobility of his birth and the exceptional nature of his talents. Though lacking subtlety and social grace, he proves time and time again that airs of civility are not needed to bring glory to Ulthuan.

mission_text.text: Tyrion is no politician, and would have floundered long ago were it not for the nobility of his birth and the exceptional nature of his talents. Though lacking subtlety and social grace, he proves time and time again that airs of civility are not needed to bring glory to Ulthuan.

text.last_approved_text: Valour of Ages

mission_text.text: Valour of Ages

text.last_approved_text: The Eagle Gate lies in the western mountains of Tiranoc, a land so utterly blighted by the Sundering that it almost vanished entirely. It clings to existence now as a corrupted foothold for Druchii incursions and a grim prophecy of what Ulthuan will become should the High Elves fail to defend it.

mission_text.text: The Eagle Gate lies in the western mountains of Tiranoc, a land so utterly blighted by the Sundering that it almost vanished entirely. It clings to existence now as a corrupted foothold for Druchii incursions and a grim prophecy of what Ulthuan will become should the High Elves fail to defend it.

text.last_approved_text: Holding Back the Darkness

mission_text.text: Holding Back the Darkness

text.last_approved_text: When the Phoenix King speaks, the High Elves listen. Tyrion is sworn to carry out the whims of his liege, and see the needs of the High Elves met. To this end, he scours the land in the name of the Phoenix King.

mission_text.text: When the Phoenix King speaks, the High Elves listen. Tyrion is sworn to carry out the whims of his liege, and see the needs of the High Elves met. To this end, he scours the land in the name of the Phoenix King.

text.last_approved_text: Whims of the Phoenix

mission_text.text: Whims of the Phoenix

text.last_approved_text: Though Tyrion is a warrior without peer, even he cannot fight the wars of the High Elves alone. From every region of Ulthuan, Tyrion must draw forces to him and, with them at his side, take furious war to his enemies.

mission_text.text: Though Tyrion is a warrior without peer, even he cannot fight the wars of the High Elves alone. From every region of Ulthuan, Tyrion must draw forces to him and, with them at his side, take furious war to his enemies.

text.last_approved_text: A Host of Glory

mission_text.text: A Host of Glory

text.last_approved_text: Tyrion discharges his duty with a powerful zeal, unlike any others of his ilk. That he is a warrior without peer is undeniable, but all the same he continues to find new ways to scale the heights of power, relentlessly crushing his enemies even in the bleakest of times.

mission_text.text: Tyrion discharges his duty with a powerful zeal, unlike any others of his ilk. That he is a warrior without peer is undeniable, but all the same he continues to find new ways to scale the heights of power, relentlessly crushing his enemies even in the bleakest of times.

text.last_approved_text: All Shall Fall

mission_text.text: All Shall Fall

text.last_approved_text: The history of the Asur is the history of great Elves doing great deeds. Whilst scores of armies march to war and Phoenixes and Dragons wheel overhead, it is the great generals - the noble leaders like Tyrion and Teclis - that drive them to glory time and time again.

mission_text.text: The history of the Asur is the history of great Elves doing great deeds. Whilst scores of armies march to war and Phoenixes and Dragons wheel overhead, it is the great generals - the noble leaders like Tyrion and Teclis - that drive them to glory time and time again.

text.last_approved_text: Those Who Would Lead

mission_text.text: Those Who Would Lead

text.last_approved_text: Griffon Gate guards the plains of Ellyrion, a land of vast plains and gentle winds. Its proximity to the blighted Tiranoc, however, means that the Griffon Gate is a crucial point for defending against any Druchii expeditions.

mission_text.text: Griffon Gate guards the plains of Ellyrion, a land of vast plains and gentle winds. Its proximity to the blighted Tiranoc, however, means that the Griffon Gate is a crucial point for defending against any Druchii expeditions.

text.last_approved_text: Gates of Paradise

mission_text.text: Gates of Paradise

text.last_approved_text: What the Phoenix King demands, Tyrion answers. He strikes out from coast to coast, encircling Ulthuan a dozen times over in his quest to rid Chaos and corruption from Asur shores. None shall stop him. Indeed, none can.

mission_text.text: What the Phoenix King demands, Tyrion answers. He strikes out from coast to coast, encircling Ulthuan a dozen times over in his quest to rid Chaos and corruption from Asur shores. None shall stop him. Indeed, none can.

text.last_approved_text: History Has Its Eyes On You

mission_text.text: History Has Its Eyes On You

text.last_approved_text: The host of the High Elves is a varied, ancient force. From the towering, ancient Dragons and ethereal and elegant Phoenixes, to the stalwart Elven foot soldiers, the High Elves bring ancient fury to their foes, scouring the world of Chaos.

mission_text.text: The host of the High Elves is a varied, ancient force. From the towering, ancient Dragons and ethereal and elegant Phoenixes, to the stalwart Elven foot soldiers, the High Elves bring ancient fury to their foes, scouring the world of Chaos.

text.last_approved_text: A Force Beyond Reckoning

mission_text.text: A Force Beyond Reckoning

text.last_approved_text: Enemies sense the relative weakness of Ulthuan and try to seize the Asur lands for themselves. Yet they underestimate the remaining strength of the Asur, who will strike with an ancient rage to defend their home.

mission_text.text: Enemies sense the relative weakness of Ulthuan and try to seize the Asur lands for themselves. Yet they underestimate the remaining strength of the Asur, who will strike with an ancient rage to defend their home.

text.last_approved_text: The Endless March

mission_text.text: The Endless March

text.last_approved_text: Tyrion is a power beyond reckoning. With the blessing of the Phoenix King, he marches to settle ancient grudges and to restore the lost glory of Ulthuan. None shall stand again him, and all those who do will be destroyed.

mission_text.text: Tyrion is a power beyond reckoning. With the blessing of the Phoenix King, he marches to settle ancient grudges and to restore the lost glory of Ulthuan. None shall stand again him, and all those who do will be destroyed.

text.last_approved_text: Tyrion to Pieces

mission_text.text: Tyrion to Pieces

text.last_approved_text: The Unicorn Gate sits amongst the Annulii Mountains, guarding Ellyrion from the Nagarythe wastes beyond. Any who wish to strike at the heart of Ulthuan must cross the mountains and pass through the gates, where stalwart Asur defenders are waiting.

mission_text.text: The Unicorn Gate sits amongst the Annulii Mountains, guarding Ellyrion from the Nagarythe wastes beyond. Any who wish to strike at the heart of Ulthuan must cross the mountains and pass through the gates, where stalwart Asur defenders are waiting.

text.last_approved_text: Defenders of the Monoceros

mission_text.text: Defenders of the Monoceros

text.last_approved_text: There is something that must be done everywhere in Ulthuan. Since the Sundering, the land is beset by grim news and growing threats. These must be faced, confronted and solved, if Ulthuan is ever to know peace.

mission_text.text: There is something that must be done everywhere in Ulthuan. Since the Sundering, the land is beset by grim news and growing threats. These must be faced, confronted and solved, if Ulthuan is ever to know peace.

text.last_approved_text: For the Sake of All

mission_text.text: For the Sake of All

text.last_approved_text: The Glittering Host of Ulthuan have waged war against their enemies for thousands and thousands of years. Nobles on Dragon-back reel in the skies above and mysterious, knife-wielding warriors lurk in the shadows beneath. All bring death to their foes, swift and brutal.

mission_text.text: The Glittering Host of Ulthuan have waged war against their enemies for thousands and thousands of years. Nobles on Dragon-back reel in the skies above and mysterious, knife-wielding warriors lurk in the shadows beneath. All bring death to their foes, swift and brutal.

text.last_approved_text: The Glittering Host

mission_text.text: The Glittering Host

text.last_approved_text: Wars are won not only by the Dragon-riding nobles of Ulthuan, though they would have you believe it. The spear-wielding, bowstring-drawing soldiery are the backbone of High Elven armies, carrying many a force to victory when the blessed Nobles have faltered.

mission_text.text: Wars are won not only by the Dragon-riding nobles of Ulthuan, though they would have you believe it. The spear-wielding, bowstring-drawing soldiery are the backbone of High Elven armies, carrying many a force to victory when the blessed Nobles have faltered.

text.last_approved_text: Asur Thing

mission_text.text: Asur Thing

text.last_approved_text: If the Phoenix King is to be successful in dragging Ulthuan from the recesses in which it languishes, he must be sure to have strong and capable leaders to help lead his forces. Only strong leadership can ensure a stable Ulthuan.

mission_text.text: If the Phoenix King is to be successful in dragging Ulthuan from the recesses in which it languishes, he must be sure to have strong and capable leaders to help lead his forces. Only strong leadership can ensure a stable Ulthuan.

text.last_approved_text: Heroes of the Age

mission_text.text: Heroes of the Age

text.last_approved_text: The Phoenix Gate carries an auspicious legacy for, much like its eponymous namesake, it has been destroyed and rebuilt many times. Yet that endurance is a source of inspiration for all those who guard it; it represents a hope that, even in darkness, the flames of new life will rise.

mission_text.text: The Phoenix Gate carries an auspicious legacy for, much like its eponymous namesake, it has been destroyed and rebuilt many times. Yet that endurance is a source of inspiration for all those who guard it; it represents a hope that, even in darkness, the flames of new life will rise.

text.last_approved_text: From the Ashes

mission_text.text: From the Ashes

text.last_approved_text: Everything must be for the greater good of Ulthuan; every task, no matter how trivial or seemingly insignificant, will be crucial. When the final history of Ulthuan is written, the epic deeds may be heralded, but the surety of the smaller deeds will never be forgotten.

mission_text.text: Everything must be for the greater good of Ulthuan; every task, no matter how trivial or seemingly insignificant, will be crucial. When the final history of Ulthuan is written, the epic deeds may be heralded, but the surety of the smaller deeds will never be forgotten.

text.last_approved_text: In His Name

mission_text.text: In His Name

text.last_approved_text: The oldest and most terrifyingly powerful of the Ulthuan Dragons are known as Star Dragons. They have seen the turn of the universe, existing longer than even the oldest High Elves can fathom. To have a Star Dragon at your side is to know that Chaos can be defeated.

mission_text.text: The oldest and most terrifyingly powerful of the Ulthuan Dragons are known as Star Dragons. They have seen the turn of the universe, existing longer than even the oldest High Elves can fathom. To have a Star Dragon at your side is to know that Chaos can be defeated.

text.last_approved_text: Rising Star

mission_text.text: Rising Star

text.last_approved_text: The forces of Chaos, and those they corrupt, must be fought tooth and nail, to the grim and bitter end. Yet no victory is so sweet as a total destruction. When the tales are written of Chaos' defeat, let them say that it was decisive.

mission_text.text: The forces of Chaos, and those they corrupt, must be fought tooth and nail, to the grim and bitter end. Yet no victory is so sweet as a total destruction. When the tales are written of Chaos' defeat, let them say that it was decisive.

text.last_approved_text: Aenarion Reborn

mission_text.text: Aenarion Reborn

text.last_approved_text: From coast to coast, as far abroad as the Lustrian expeditions, they speak of Tyrion's power and might. Truly, they say, there are none amongst him as powerful. Soldiers brag of having fought alongside him, giving praise to the one they call Aenarion reborn.

mission_text.text: From coast to coast, as far abroad as the Lustrian expeditions, they speak of Tyrion's power and might. Truly, they say, there are none amongst him as powerful. Soldiers brag of having fought alongside him, giving praise to the one they call Aenarion reborn.

text.last_approved_text: Army of One

mission_text.text: Army of One

text.last_approved_text: Nagarythe is the homeland of the first Phoenix King and of the Dreadlord, Malekith. That both Asur and Druchii alike lay claim to it makes it one of the most fiercely contested, yet blighted, lands in all of Ulthuan. Even now, the Druchii creep towards its desolate shores...

mission_text.text: Nagarythe is the homeland of the first Phoenix King and of the Dreadlord, Malekith. That both Asur and Druchii alike lay claim to it makes it one of the most fiercely contested, yet blighted, lands in all of Ulthuan. Even now, the Druchii creep towards its desolate shores...

text.last_approved_text: A Blighted Place

mission_text.text: A Blighted Place

text.last_approved_text: Ulthuan must be made pure, must be kept free of all corruption, if the Vortex is to be sustained and the world saved from destruction. To this end, every enemy must be crushed, every foe eradicated, and every whim of the Phoenix King met.

mission_text.text: Ulthuan must be made pure, must be kept free of all corruption, if the Vortex is to be sustained and the world saved from destruction. To this end, every enemy must be crushed, every foe eradicated, and every whim of the Phoenix King met.

text.last_approved_text: In the Name of the King

mission_text.text: In the Name of the King

text.last_approved_text: Kroq-Gar has been handed a task most illustrious and most grave by Mazdamundi - to prosecute the destruction of all those not part of the Old Ones Great Plan. There can be no Plan whilst they yet live, so Kroq-Gar's knows his mission is vital.

mission_text.text: Kroq-Gar has been handed a task most illustrious and most grave by Mazdamundi - to prosecute the destruction of all those not part of the Old Ones Great Plan. There can be no Plan whilst they yet live, so Kroq-Gar's knows his mission is vital.

text.last_approved_text: From Rubble We Begin…

mission_text.text: From Rubble We Begin…

text.last_approved_text: Lustria lies largely in ruin, thanks to the Great Catastrophe. In the times that follow, warm-blooded men and beasts have settled upon the continent; they have no right to the sacred land they occupy. They must be expelled!

mission_text.text: Lustria lies largely in ruin, thanks to the Great Catastrophe. In the times that follow, warm-blooded men and beasts have settled upon the continent; they have no right to the sacred land they occupy. They must be expelled!

text.last_approved_text: Raze Me Up

mission_text.text: Raze Me Up

text.last_approved_text: Lustria is a land of a Lizardmen past; a ruined civilisation, left to be reclaimed by the jungles. It is an outrage and an insult, then, when malfeasant men and heathenish rats make a home amongst the rubble. Put simply, they must all be evicted.

mission_text.text: Lustria is a land of a Lizardmen past; a ruined civilisation, left to be reclaimed by the jungles. It is an outrage and an insult, then, when malfeasant men and heathenish rats make a home amongst the rubble. Put simply, they must all be evicted.

text.last_approved_text: Fury of the Vengeful

mission_text.text: Fury of the Vengeful

text.last_approved_text: Kroq-Gar is borne aloft by a centuries-old rage, a fury that was instilled in him by the Great Catastrophe and the coming of Chaos. The fury of those lost at Xhotl will never ebb, and Kroq-Qar will never stop pursuing those responsible.

mission_text.text: Kroq-Gar is borne aloft by a centuries-old rage, a fury that was instilled in him by the Great Catastrophe and the coming of Chaos. The fury of those lost at Xhotl will never ebb, and Kroq-Qar will never stop pursuing those responsible.

text.last_approved_text: Call of the Jungle

mission_text.text: Call of the Jungle

text.last_approved_text: Every insult that the Lizardmen have been dealt by Chaos, by man, by the snivelling Skaven - all will be repaid tenfold. Every lair they hide in will be crushed, every settlement burned, every defiled temple reclaimed.

mission_text.text: Every insult that the Lizardmen have been dealt by Chaos, by man, by the snivelling Skaven - all will be repaid tenfold. Every lair they hide in will be crushed, every settlement burned, every defiled temple reclaimed.

text.last_approved_text: Dino Another Day

mission_text.text: Dino Another Day

text.last_approved_text: From the bowels of the earth, the Skaven rise, an inescapable tide of pestilent destruction. It is the Skaven's desire to reclaim the world from the surface-dwellers, and they will do so in an unending tide of skittering claws and jagged teeth.

mission_text.text: From the bowels of the earth, the Skaven rise, an inescapable tide of pestilent destruction. It is the Skaven's desire to reclaim the world from the surface-dwellers, and they will do so in an unending tide of skittering claws and jagged teeth.

text.last_approved_text: Uprisings from Below

mission_text.text: Uprisings from Below

text.last_approved_text: The Skaven once decreed that never again would they be brought low by their own imperfect creations. Such a flawed device nearly led to their eradication in Skavenblight. Since then, it is decreed they should spread the world over, and so they have.

mission_text.text: The Skaven once decreed that never again would they be brought low by their own imperfect creations. Such a flawed device nearly led to their eradication in Skavenblight. Since then, it is decreed they should spread the world over, and so they have.

text.last_approved_text: From One, Many

mission_text.text: From One, Many

text.last_approved_text: Although the Under-Empire is seemingly endless, it is not a squalid subterranean life the Skaven desire. Filled with bile and hatred for the surface-dwellers, they desire to spread across the surface like locusts, and claim what they believe to be theirs.

mission_text.text: Although the Under-Empire is seemingly endless, it is not a squalid subterranean life the Skaven desire. Filled with bile and hatred for the surface-dwellers, they desire to spread across the surface like locusts, and claim what they believe to be theirs.

text.last_approved_text: Ratman Begins

mission_text.text: Ratman Begins

text.last_approved_text: It is only the Dwarfs who understand the threat of the Skaven, for every other race does not believe in that which they cannot see. Yet even the mountain-dwellers cannot grasp the true enormity of the threat they encounter in the Underway; for there are always more Skaven...

mission_text.text: It is only the Dwarfs who understand the threat of the Skaven, for every other race does not believe in that which they cannot see. Yet even the mountain-dwellers cannot grasp the true enormity of the threat they encounter in the Underway; for there are always more Skaven...

text.last_approved_text: Enemy Unknown

mission_text.text: Enemy Unknown

text.last_approved_text: The Under Empire is vast, and the Skaven desires for war with the surface dwellers is strong. Beneath every city, lies a verminous lair - eternal strongholds of the ratmen. Each and every one will be used, one day, to bring vile destruction the world over.

mission_text.text: The Under Empire is vast, and the Skaven desires for war with the surface dwellers is strong. Beneath every city, lies a verminous lair - eternal strongholds of the ratmen. Each and every one will be used, one day, to bring vile destruction the world over.

text.last_approved_text: The Over-Empire

mission_text.text: The Over-Empire

text.last_approved_text: The frozen lands of Naggaroth are a far cry from the glittering beauty of Ulthuan, but it is the Druchii home now. So, they will claim as much of it as possible, and forge a new kingdom from the chilled wastes.

mission_text.text: The frozen lands of Naggaroth are a far cry from the glittering beauty of Ulthuan, but it is the Druchii home now. So, they will claim as much of it as possible, and forge a new kingdom from the chilled wastes.

text.last_approved_text: Vengeance Incarnate

mission_text.text: Vengeance Incarnate

text.last_approved_text: It was by the Druchii's hands that the Sundering was brought about. Malekith's forces duelled with the Asur for control of the Great Vortex, and the struggle resulted in a savage cataclysm that rend the world asunder. Malekith would see that again, if he could.

mission_text.text: It was by the Druchii's hands that the Sundering was brought about. Malekith's forces duelled with the Asur for control of the Great Vortex, and the struggle resulted in a savage cataclysm that rend the world asunder. Malekith would see that again, if he could.

text.last_approved_text: Druchii Ascendant

mission_text.text: Druchii Ascendant

text.last_approved_text: The Dark Elves made their homes in the towering Black Arks that bore them aloft to Naggaroth. Once beached, they became fortresses for the Druchii. From here, they launch expeditions into Naggaroth, to explore and conquer the frozen land.

mission_text.text: The Dark Elves made their homes in the towering Black Arks that bore them aloft to Naggaroth. Once beached, they became fortresses for the Druchii. From here, they launch expeditions into Naggaroth, to explore and conquer the frozen land.

text.last_approved_text: Wrecked Ships & Chill

mission_text.text: Wrecked Ships & Chill

text.last_approved_text: The Merciless Host marches with a relentless cadence, beating out a drumbeat to destruction. From the rank and file soldiery to the terrifying and imposing beasts of war, all are aligned with Malekith's singular vision of destruction.

mission_text.text: The Merciless Host marches with a relentless cadence, beating out a drumbeat to destruction. From the rank and file soldiery to the terrifying and imposing beasts of war, all are aligned with Malekith's singular vision of destruction.

text.last_approved_text: Scorched Earth

mission_text.text: Scorched Earth

text.last_approved_text: The Dark Elves were born to rule over others; strength begets strength, and that strength confers power over the weak; dominion over those unable to stop them. Any Druchii not strong enough to dominate others is fit only for death.

mission_text.text: The Dark Elves were born to rule over others; strength begets strength, and that strength confers power over the weak; dominion over those unable to stop them. Any Druchii not strong enough to dominate others is fit only for death.

text.last_approved_text: Burn it - Burn it All!

mission_text.text: Burn it - Burn it All!

text.last_approved_text: Whilst other, lesser creatures think in minutes and hours, Mazdamundi contemplates in centuries. His plans are beyond temporal comprehension, and now, with great deliberation, moves to war. For Mazdamundi sees the wheel of time, and endeavours to turn it himself.

mission_text.text: Whilst other, lesser creatures think in minutes and hours, Mazdamundi contemplates in centuries. His plans are beyond temporal comprehension, and now, with great deliberation, moves to war. For Mazdamundi sees the wheel of time, and endeavours to turn it himself.

text.last_approved_text: From Rubble We Begin…

mission_text.text: From Rubble We Begin…

text.last_approved_text: The history of the Lizardmen is written in blood; great volumes of war that have left their mark on land and lizard alike. War is all-consuming for Mazdamundi; only through relentless military undertaking can Chaos be kept at bay, and the Great Plan realised.

mission_text.text: The history of the Lizardmen is written in blood; great volumes of war that have left their mark on land and lizard alike. War is all-consuming for Mazdamundi; only through relentless military undertaking can Chaos be kept at bay, and the Great Plan realised.

text.last_approved_text: …To Rubble We Return

mission_text.text: …To Rubble We Return

text.last_approved_text: The onslaught of Chaos, and time, have made ruins of so many of the Lustrian temples. As the jungle attempts to reclaim them, so too do others. This cannot be allowed. If the Lizardmen cannot reclaim their homes, they should be destroyed.

mission_text.text: The onslaught of Chaos, and time, have made ruins of so many of the Lustrian temples. As the jungle attempts to reclaim them, so too do others. This cannot be allowed. If the Lizardmen cannot reclaim their homes, they should be destroyed.

text.last_approved_text: Itza Problem

mission_text.text: Itza Problem

text.last_approved_text: So much was lost in the Great Catastrophe; Chupayotl collapsed into the sea, whilst the city of gold was taken by the Skaven. Now, what is able to be reclaimed, must be reclaimed, and Mazdamundi will see it done. For the Old Ones are surely watching…

mission_text.text: So much was lost in the Great Catastrophe; Chupayotl collapsed into the sea, whilst the city of gold was taken by the Skaven. Now, what is able to be reclaimed, must be reclaimed, and Mazdamundi will see it done. For the Old Ones are surely watching…

text.last_approved_text: Fury of Lustria

mission_text.text: Fury of Lustria

text.last_approved_text: The Old Ones created the Lizardmen as the chosen race, favoured and nurtured by their celestial masters. Others may be permitted, but not at the expense of the Lizardmen. The Slann know this, and must eradicate any that harbour dark desires upon Lustrian ideals.

mission_text.text: The Old Ones created the Lizardmen as the chosen race, favoured and nurtured by their celestial masters. Others may be permitted, but not at the expense of the Lizardmen. The Slann know this, and must eradicate any that harbour dark desires upon Lustrian ideals.
Self-Correction

text.last_approved_text: The Over-Empire

mission_text.text: The Over-Empire

text.last_approved_text: This world was once the dominion of the High Elves; now they are brought to lesser significance in the twilight of their race. Yet their fury and pride have not diminished - from Ulthuan, the High Elves continue to strike out at their enemies, in defence of the world.

mission_text.text: This world was once the dominion of the High Elves; now they are brought to lesser significance in the twilight of their race. Yet their fury and pride have not diminished - from Ulthuan, the High Elves continue to strike out at their enemies, in defence of the world.

text.last_approved_text: Flames of Rebirth

mission_text.text: Flames of Rebirth

text.last_approved_text: After the Sundering, too much was allowed to fall into Druchii hands, and so much else slipped into the oceans. What cannot be saved, must be destroyed, and the enemies of Ulthuan hounded to the ends of the earth!

mission_text.text: After the Sundering, too much was allowed to fall into Druchii hands, and so much else slipped into the oceans. What cannot be saved, must be destroyed, and the enemies of Ulthuan hounded to the ends of the earth!

text.last_approved_text: What Would Be

mission_text.text: What Would Be

text.last_approved_text: There are enemies of the Asur everywhere, and enemies of the Asur are enemies of the world itself. To the west, the Dark Elves plot the destruction of all life, so corrupted have they become. They, and their ilk, cannot be suffered to survive!

mission_text.text: There are enemies of the Asur everywhere, and enemies of the Asur are enemies of the world itself. To the west, the Dark Elves plot the destruction of all life, so corrupted have they become. They, and their ilk, cannot be suffered to survive!

text.last_approved_text: Kill Your Darlings

mission_text.text: Kill Your Darlings

text.last_approved_text: If Ulthuan is to be free, to know peace, or to regain a semblance of its former glory, then all enemies must be expelled from the land, and then pursued to their source and destroyed.

mission_text.text: If Ulthuan is to be free, to know peace, or to regain a semblance of its former glory, then all enemies must be expelled from the land, and then pursued to their source and destroyed.

text.last_approved_text: Ulthuan Rising

mission_text.text: Ulthuan Rising

text.last_approved_text: At the heart of Ulthuan lies the Vortex; a dimensional rift that, through the actions of the High Elves, holds the world together. If the Vortex falls - as some would see it do - then the world will be ripped apart. All enemies of the Vortex must therefore be vanquished!

mission_text.text: At the heart of Ulthuan lies the Vortex; a dimensional rift that, through the actions of the High Elves, holds the world together. If the Vortex falls - as some would see it do - then the world will be ripped apart. All enemies of the Vortex must therefore be vanquished!

text.last_approved_text: A Future Secured

mission_text.text: A Future Secured

text.last_approved_text: This world was once the dominion of the High Elves; now they are brought to lesser significance in the twilight of their race. Yet their fury and pride have not diminished - from Ulthuan, the High Elves continue to strike out at their enemies, in defence of the world.

mission_text.text: This world was once the dominion of the High Elves; now they are brought to lesser significance in the twilight of their race. Yet their fury and pride have not diminished - from Ulthuan, the High Elves continue to strike out at their enemies, in defence of the world.

text.last_approved_text: Flames of Rebirth

mission_text.text: Flames of Rebirth

text.last_approved_text: After the Sundering, too much was allowed to fall into Druchii hands, and so much else slipped into the oceans. What cannot be saved must be destroyed, and the enemies of Ulthuan hounded to the ends of the earth.

mission_text.text: After the Sundering, too much was allowed to fall into Druchii hands, and so much else slipped into the oceans. What cannot be saved must be destroyed, and the enemies of Ulthuan hounded to the ends of the earth.

text.last_approved_text: What Would Be

mission_text.text: What Would Be

mission_text.text: A Future Secured

text.last_approved_text: Control all provinces of Ulthuan either by direct ownership or through [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassals and [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]military allies:
